channel.title: You Turn Podcast w/ Ashley Stahl
channel.itunes:summary: Bestselling author, speaker and career expert Ashley Stahl (@ashleystahl) goes deep with insightful, inspiring guests each week to help you elevate your confidence in work, love and life. Get ready to laugh, cry, and make "You Turns" alongside Ash, your wise silly bestie who is committed to helping you own who you truly are. Don't forget to take Ashley's free quiz to discover your most authentic career path at AshleyStahl.com/podcastquiz.

item.title: Ep 278 [MINDSET] Quantum Physics 101: How Tap Into Higher Vibes with Suzanne Adams
item.itunes:title: Ep 278 [MINDSET] Quantum Physics 101: How Tap Into Higher Vibes with Suzanne Adams
item.description:
What is your heart telling you today? 

 

This week Ash sits down with Suzanne Adams, a highly sought-after motivational speaker, author, and transformational coach who has inspired thousands. Suzanne is here to discuss the confluence of the law of attraction, spirituality, and science.

 

If you’ve ever wondered why you connect with certain people and places and are turned off from others, Suzanne shares why this happens and how to navigate these moments with grace. 

 

Ash and Suzanne dive into manifestation, how to shift your energy and reframe your mind. Suzanne also walks you through a powerful exercise to tap into the truth of your heart. This episode is warm, punchy, and a beautiful glimpse into the depths of this world. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The simple truth around what quantum physics is.
  2. How to understand the difference between feminie and masculine energy.
  3. Manifestation 101: How to call in what you want with an open heart and mind.
  4. The wheels in your heart exercise.

 

Where to Connect with Suzanne Adams:

Get Her New Book: Quantum Vibes by Suzanne Adams

Get A Free Gift With Your Book: suzanneadamsinc.com/free-gift

https://www.instagram.com/suzanneadamsinc/

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 277 How To Land Media + Press To Build Your Personal Brand (and career) with Jessica Abowith Jessica Abo
item.itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 276 How To Land Media + Press To Build Your Personal Brand (and career) with Jessica Abowith Jessica Abo
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book, You Turn, at youturnbook.com!

 

Jessica Abo is a media trainer and award-winning journalist with over two decades of experience as a news anchor. She is here to help you share your mission and story with the world and land your dream press opportunities. 

 

Are you currently living in the “spray and pray” strategy for getting press or being heard? Jessica shares clear and simple strategies for thoughtful outreach to connect with your dream publications. 

 

Whether you are a business owner or an employee in a large-scale company, your career brand matters, and getting press is key to growing your career. Jessica and Ash dive deep into all things press, publicity, and leveraging social media for career growth. Be sure to tune in…your career with thank you!

 

Key Topics:

  1. How to be magnetic, stand out, and invite the press to come to you.
  2. Tools for intentional outreach.
  3. Questions to ask yourself to guide your press strategy.
  4. How to connect versus be performative.
  5. Tips to optimize each press opportunity for maximum exposure.

 

Connect with Jessica Abo

https://www.jessicaabo.com/

https://www.instagram.com/jessicaabotv/

item.title: [SOULO] Ep. 276 22 Insights I Learned In 2022 Part 2
item.description:
[SOULO] Ep. 276 22 Insights I Learned In 2022 Part 2

 

Welcome to the second part of this soulo episode! Ashley shares the second half of the 22 insights she learned this past year.  main insights and learnings she has witnessed and experienced in the past year, starting off with her thoughts on who is her ultimate guide.

 

Ash dives into envy versus jealousy, connection versus commitment, and so much more. A powerful prompt is shared to help you connect more deeply with your year and life ahead.  This episode is thoughtful, provoking, and deeply nourishing to the soul. Tune in for a moment to sweeten your life!

 

In This Episode, You’ll learn

  1. The difference between envy and jealousy. 
  2. The three roots that direct your decisions when faced with making choices.
  3. The balance between living your life and navigating personal development and healing.
  4. What message you are sending yourself based on what you are consuming?

 

Ready to support your body every single day? 

 

Get the Complete Essential Daily MultiVitamin Pack + NAD!

Visit ashleystahl.com/vitamins or ashleystahl.com/vitaminsmen 

 

Connect with Ash:

https://www.instagram.com/ashleystahl/

https://www.ashleystahl.com/freequiz/

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 275 MAN-ifesting Love 101 with Jaime Bronstein
item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 275 MAN-ifesting Love 101 with Jamie Bronstein
item.description:
Get your copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Who are you manifesting into your love life?

 

This week, Ash talks to Jaime Bronstein all about how to manifest love into your life. Jaime is an LCSW, relationship expert, and host of the Love Talk Live show on LA Talk Radio.

 

If you feel like there are “no good guys left” or “you only find guys who aren't looking for anything serious,” you may be living in a victim-mode mindset and state of being. Jaime and Ash talk through how to shift into a thriving mode of love, decipher levels of attraction, prepare yourself for the right relationship…and so much more.

 

Whether you are dating, living the full solo life, or in a relationship, Jaime shares the three aspects of yourself to work on to grow your heart and love life.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to move from victim mode into thriving mode.  
  2. What you should feel in your body, mind, and heart.
  3. 3 aspects of yourself to work on, whether you are dating or in a relationship.
  4. Phantom exes: what they are, how to handle them, and when to let go.

 

Connect with Jaime Bronstein:

Get a copy of her book MAN*ifesting: A Step-by-Step Guide to Attracting the Love That Is Meant for You

Jaime is gifting a 7 Day of Manifesting Love Series for FREE...CLICK HERE to sign up!

item.title: [WORK] Ep.274 9 Rules To Calm The Chaos and Make Time for What Matters with Laura Vanderkam
item.description:
Do you live a calm life?

 

This week Ash sits down with Laura Vanderkam, a writer, author, and speaker, to share insight on work-life balance, productivity, and time management. 

 

The average American has worked an extra hour per day since the pandemic. This adds up to almost being a part-time job. Laura shares tools to hack your time back and bring balance into your life. These rules are simple and actionable. 

 

Do you struggle to create peaceful moments in your life or find that life is stacked with one stressful day after another? Laura is here to help you bring tranquility into your life. This episode is magical, practical and completely filled with valuable reminders of how to live. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. 9 ways to calm the cause and make time for what matters.
  2. How To Gain Control of Your Freetime
  3. When you should go to bed and why.
  4. A planning strategy to execute your goals - personal and work. 
  5. How to enjoy effortful fun, effortless fun, and everything in between.

 

Where to Find Laura Vanderkam:

https://lauravanderkam.com/

Get the Book Tranquility by Tuesday

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety.

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 273 5 Ways You’re Derailing Your Confidence (and How to Rebuild It!) with Nicole Kalil
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 273 5 Ways You’re Derailing Your Confidence (and How to Rebuild It!) with Nicole Kalil
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How confident do you feel today?

 

This week, Ash sits down with Nicole Kalil, a speaker, leadership strategist, coach, and host of the “This Is Woman’s Work” podcast, to discuss all things confidence: how to build it up, ways you may be losing self-worth and how to integrate confidence into your business and relationships with grace and ease.

 

We often use the word confidence incorrectly. We so often think it is about feeling good, successful, or attractive. The truth is, that confidence is about trusting yourself boldly. Nicole and Ash discuss building trust within yourself and taking action from this part of your being.

 

If you are struggling to believe in yourself or are looking for ways to build upon your sense of confidence, there is something powerful in this episode for you. You don’t want to miss this!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. An exercise to get to know yourself and reconnect to who you truly are.
  2. What feedback from someone truly means. 
  3. What confidence really means, and how to attain true confidence 
  4. Five ways we derail confidence 
  5. What head trash is and how to break free from the control this element has over your confidence.

Where You Can Find Nicole Kalil

https://nicolekalil.com/

This Is Women’s Work Podcast

Connect on IG: @nicolemkalil

https://www.instagram.com/nicolemkalil/



SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.title: [SOULO] Ep 272 22 Insights From 2022 Part 1
item.description:
Who is your guru?

 

In this soulo episode, Ashley shares the main insights and learnings she has witnessed and experienced in the past year, starting off with her thoughts on who is her ultimate guide.

 

Ash dives into how she observes momentum, making assumptions, and where to find the answers to your burning questions in life. This episode is thoughtful, provoking, and deeply nourishing to the soul. Tune in for a moment to sweeten your life! 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between masculine and feminine energy and how to tap into each.
  2. The seed, the sprout, and the bloom- what these are and how they show up in your life.
  3. A journaling prompt to spark creativity and momentum.
  4. A mindset tool to move out of broken cycles in your life and create inspired action.

Ebony Rafaeli is a social worker with over 15 years of experience in child services. Ebony is here to discuss how to reach deeper fulfillment through the experience of foster parenting. 

Ash discusses leadership, fulfillment, and making changes in your life…if these spaces feel aligned with your values, this episode will truly light you up. While it isn’t the traditional mindset conversation, Ash and Ebony discuss leadership in action, mindset shifts under pressure, and how to look in unique places for your purpose. 

This is a truly impactful episode packed with actionable value and sprinkles of inspiration. Don’t miss this!

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What to consider when looking into fostering.
  2. Insight into sex trafficking: how this looks in action and how it impacts young women.
  3. The mindset to take when exploring a new venture in life.

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 270 Healing Trauma Through Breathwork with Sam Skelly
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 270 Healing Trauma Through Breathwork with Sam Skelly
item.description:
How often do you notice your breath?

 

This week, Ash invites back onto the show Sam Skelly. Sam is the founder of Pause Breathwork and author of Hungry For Happiness. Ash and Sam dive deep today with a conversation on healing trauma and how breathwork plays into this journey. 

 

Trauma can occur in many ways and places of life and can heavily impact daily life. So how can you naturally and permanently heal? Sam shares the power of breathwork to heal trauma, preprogram the brain and naturally shift survival strategies.

 

While breathwork is a powerful inward experience, Sam also shares what external actions and practices to focus on for healing and expansion. 

  

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to incorporate breathwork into your daily life.
  2. The science of breathwork and how it heals trauma.
  3. The connection between childhood experiences and disease.
  4. Tools to approach breathwork for success if you are just beginning or an expert.

 

Where to Find Sam Skelly:

Try Pause Breathwork: https://pause.live/ashleystahl

Get Sam’s Book: Hungry For Happiness

 

Resources:

Scared Sick: Roll of Childhood Trauma by Robin Karr-Morse 

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 269 How To Use TikTok To Grow Your Business & Amplify Your Life with Jesse Rubinstein
item.description:
How do you use social media to amplify your life?

 

This week, Ash dives into social media with special guest Jesse Rubinstein. Jesse is the founder and CEO of Hello There Collective and is here to share how to use social media platforms like TikTok to grow your business, connect with others authentically and navigate social media for growth and inspiration.

 

Jesse and Ash discuss how to share on social media from an authentic space, effective ways to incorporate brands into a growing account, and tactics to leverage social media to monetize your business. Whether you are growing an online business or looking for ways to use social media healthily, Jesse has valuable insight for you. You don’t want to miss this episode!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to share content on a topic you are beginning to explore.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 268 How to Heal Your Nervous System and Sustain Elite Performance with Laura Larios
item.description:
How do you operate under pressure?

 

This week, Ash invites Laura Larios onto the show to discuss how to heal your nervous system and sustain the elite performance you aspire to sustain. 

 

Laura is the founder and CEO of a highly sought-after consulting and coaching brand that delivers world-class nervous system and adrenal support for high-performing women in the corporate, network marketing, entrepreneurial, and coaching industries.

 

If you are struggling with burnout or trying to navigate how to show up as the high performer you dream of being…this episode is for you. Laura breaks down the physiological reactions unfolding when under stress and how to physically and mentally manage these reactions.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Tools to heal your nervous system.
  2. Polyvagal theory - what it is and how you can use it to perform better.
  3. Methods to recover from burnout.
  4. How to sustain elite performance in a stressful workplace.
  5. Fight, flight, freeze, and fawn- what these responses look like and how they impact your daily life.

 

Where to Connect with Laura Larios

https://lauralisalarios.com/

https://www.instagram.com/lauralisalarios

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 266 How To Choose the Right Life Partner with John and Ana Mann
item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 266 How To Choose the Right Life Partner with John and Ana Mann
item.description:
How does your love life feel?

This week Ash talks with John and Ana Mann all about the five secrets to creating lasting love. John is a NY Times Bestselling Author, and Ana Mann is an educator and therapist who currently coaches Go-Giver Marriage clients.

Have you found yourself in a relationship filled with criticism or left you walking on eggshells to keep them happy? John and Ana discuss the truth beneath relationship behaviors and how to break free from these limiting cycles. 

Here is an episode that will teach you how to feel seen and heard…and be a partner who can see and hear their significant other. This episode is SO juicy, you don’t want to miss out!

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The five secrets to lasting love.
  2. A cognitive behavioral approach to love.
  3. How to get out of a negative loop - especially if you overanalyze a situation or person.
  4. Enmeshment: what it is and how this can impact your relationship.
  5. How to continue to grow and remain connected in partnership.
  6. Questions to ask to better understand who someone will become.

Where To Connect with John and Ana Mann

https://gogivermarriage.com/

Connect with Ash:

https://www.instagram.com/ashleystahl/

item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 265 How To Be Your Authentic Self & Create Real Love In Your Life with Jamie Rea
item.description:
This week, Ash talks with Jamie Rea, a transformation coach with deep insights into relationships. Jamie is here to discuss how to return how to yourself.

 

Ash and Jamie discuss the truth beneath masculine and feminine source energy and how valuable this topic is for coming back to your true essence. Jamie shares the energetic pathway to receive joy and love from the person of your dreams. 

 

This episdoe is for you if you are ready to step into the depths of yourself, connect with your energy and move towards more love within your life!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The revealing of karma: what karma is, and what happens when it shows up.
  2. How to disipher the true reason behind running away or being “busy”.
  3. Feminine and masculine source essence: combining energy movement and connection through the body.  
  4. Insights and phylosophies around returning home to yourself.
  5. A process to recover from trauma and become reborn as yourself.
  6. The unconscious stories you tell yourself about what love you deserve.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 264 How To Use Astrology to Amplify Your Career & Life with Ophira Edut
item.itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 264 How To Use Astrology to Amplify Your Career & Life with Ophira Edut
item.description:
Are you ready to learn more about the best career for you?

 

This week, Ash has a unique career conversation about how to use your astrology sight to amplify your career with Ophira Edut, Ophira is an entrepreneur, and co-founder of Astrostyle a professional astrologer source who reaches millions worldwide, and the official astrologer for ELLE magazine.

 

Whether you read your horoscope every day or you are a skeptic, Ophira shares how to use astrology as a tool in life. She views astrology is a way to become more aware of blind spots and determine your strengths to amplify how you show up in the world.

 

Ophira breaks down what an influencer, authority, and maven are and how to use your astrology sign to build a successful career. If you are looking for personalized guidance on how to optimize your career, optimize your work life and show up as the best version of yourself, this episode is for you!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Practical applications of astrology: how to use astrology as a tool, not a rule of life. 
  2. A breakdown of the astrology signs: strengths, weaknesses.
  3. The best career paths based on your astrology sign.
  4. Elemental groups: Earth, Air, and Water- what your astrology element group means and how to leverage this knowledge for career advancement. 



Where To Connect with Ophira:

https://astrostyle.com/

astrostyle.com/astropreneurs

item.description:
How close are you to financial freedom?

 

This week, Ash talks to Jamila Souffrant, a money expert and host of the Journey to Launch Podcast. Jamila is here to share how to create financial freedom in your life.

 

Jamila shares the 5 stages towards financial freedom, tune in to learn what stage you are currently in and how to move forward towards financial independence. Whether you are ready to get out of debt, build a financial foundation for the future or prepare for retirement, Jamila and Ash discuss valuable and actionable insight to improve your finances. 

 

This episode is all about how to improve your money mindset and reach financial independence. You don’t want to miss it!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to save money without sacrificing your lifestyle.
  2. Steps to take towards financial freedom.
  3. The 5 Stages of financial independence and how to move through each.
  4. A mindset to help you feel good spending money.
  5. Roth IRA, 401K, and whether to save while you pay off debt.

 

Where To Connect with Jamila Souffrant:

https://journeytolaunch.com/

https://www.instagram.com/journeytolaunch/?hl=en

 

 

Athletic Greens:

 

Ready to reclaim your health and arm your immune system with nutrition?

 

Visit athleticgreens.com/YOUTURN to get a FREE 1 year supply of immune-supporting Vitamin D AND 5 FREE travel packs with your first purchase.

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep 262 The 12 Coping Styles You Learned As a Child and How To Heal From Them with Dr. Sam Rader
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep 262 The 12 Coping Styles You Learned As a Child and How To Heal From Them with Dr. Sam Rader
item.description:
How do you cope with challenging times?

 

This week Ash sits down with psychologist Dr. Sam Rader to discuss the distinct ways we manage challenges in life, and what that really means. Dr. Sam is the owner and director at the Source Code Center where she guides a team of Source Code Conduits, who hold space for people to shed their defenses and step into wholeness.

​

Source Code is the practice of identifying the unconscious algorithms behind our negative patterns and rewriting them for a healthier, more beautiful life. Sounds great right? Well in this episode Dr. Sam breaks down the various ways we cope, what that means for living an abundant life and how to heal from struggles for good.

 

Do you know someone who is extremely flighty- always on the go or perhaps jumping ship when something challenging happens? Or are you someone who always has life put together, never showing faults or vulnerability? These are all coping styles and impact life in vast ways. Tune in to learn how to cope with these responses and how to use them to your best potential.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What the 12 different coping styles are and how they show up in your life.
  2. The four sub-types of being disconnected.
  3. Tools to identify when you are copying and how to step into abundance.
  4. How your childhood can impact and determine your coping mechanisms.

 

Where To Connect with Dr. Sam Rader

https://www.drsamrader.com/

https://www.instagram.com/drsamrader/

General Assembly:

 

Do you want to pursue a career in tech or are you ready to explore a new career path? 

 

Based on what’s worked, General Assembly has built an in-depth guide to help you break into tech.  Simply download the guide at ga.co/guide

 

BiOptimizers

Do you want an energized life?

Visit magbreakthrough.com/youturn and use coupon code youturn to activate an exclusive limited-time offer. 

For a limited time, BiOptimizers - the makers of Magnesium Breakthrough - is offering additional bonus gifts for the next 1,000 customers... 

They are including free bottles of their full line of digestive health products including their powerful digestive enzymes - MassZymes, their patented probiotic - that alleviates heartburn and acid reflux.

This offer is ONLY available at  http://magbreakthrough.com/youturn

SOUL CBD

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.title: [BONUS] EP. 261 Vibrant Happy Woman Podcast Host Jen Riday discusses Emotional Safety
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] EP. 261 Vibrant Happy Woman Podcast Host Jen Riday discusses Emotional Safety
item.description:
Where do you feel most emotionally safe? 

Maybe it’s with your spouse, perhaps it’s with your closest friends. For some of you, you might not have found your emotionally safe space yet and that’s okay. Today's conversation will help you find it.

In this bonus episode, Ash shares the Vibrant Happy Woman podcast where host Jen Riday discusses emotional safety with two dynamic guests. Jen Riday is the Founder of the Vibrant Happy Women Movement and host of the Vibrant Happy Women Podcast. 

Listen in today to discover what emotional safety is, where to find it, and why you so deeply deserve to feel emotionally safe. When you feel grounded and calm, you help your kids and everyone around you also feels that way. Learn why we as women sometimes struggle with feeling emotionally safe and how you can create the spaces and relationships that make you feel safe.

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Why we need emotional safety.
  2. What it means to be well-regulated.
  3. How to stay grounded around people who aren’t.
  4. The difference between emotional and physical safety.
  5. Our advice for anyone seeking emotional safety.  
  6. What makes each of us feel emotionally safe.

 

Connect with Jen Riday

https://www.jenriday.com/podcast/

https://www.instagram.com/jenriday/

https://www.facebook.com/jenriday

Join the Vibrant Happy Women Club

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 260 All Things Period: What You Didn’t Know About Your Menstrual Cycle, Birth Control + More!
item.itunes:title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 260 All Things Period: What You Didn’t Know About Your Menstrual Cycle, Birth Control + More!
item.description:
How are your period symptoms affecting your life?

 

This week, Ash tackles all the wellness and health aspects of menstrual cycles with guest Mimi Millard. Mimi is the founder and CEO of de lune, a period relief product business. Mimi is on a mission to lift the period burden, naturally.

 

Producing estrogen and progesterone production has massive general health benefits when it comes to bone health, inflammation, cognitive function, and more. Mimi walks through these hormones and how birth control impacts their role in your body. 

 

Whether you are struggling with period symptoms, looking for insight on birth control, or are looking for ways to support someone through the ebbs and flows of a cycle…this is a powerful episode packed with science-based insights and personal anecdotes to support you. It's time to put an end to the burden of a period…and it can be done naturally.



In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The connection between birth control and period symptoms.
  2. Cycle Health: what is happening in your body in each phase, the “inner seasons” and the importance of healthy ovulation and periods. 
  3. Navigating relief options: the pros and cons of birth control and painkillers.
  4. Ways to optimize the different phases of your cycle for creativity and productivity.



De Lune:

Ready to feel relief from your period symptoms…naturally?

 

Visit https://www.delune.co/ and use Code YOUTURN20 for 20% your order. 

 

Modern Fertility

 

Curious about your fertility or hormone health?

 

Visit https://modernfertility.com/youturn/ and get $20 OFF your test!

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 259 Embrace the Strength and Power of Your Story with Stephanie Raffelock
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 259 Embrace the Strength and Power of Your Story with Stephanie Raffelock
item.description:
How do you feel about your age?

 

This week, Ash talks with Stephanie Raffelock a motivational speaker, blogger, podcaster, and author with so much to share about aging and unlocking your true power. 

We are all aging, and at times that can be challenging to accept let alone embrace. Stephanie is here to offer support, insight, and guidance on how to not only embrace your current stage of life but to truly thrive as you are. In true Ash fashion, your host gets honest and real about what she is going through when faced with her current state of being.

 

If you are struggling to feel beautiful in your own skin, tired of the comparison that lives on social media, this episode is for you. Beauty is in all of us, at any age!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn

  1. How to love yourself as you are and be open to changes.
  2. The ability to have a fulfilled life as you innate are.
  3. What it means to be a creatrix- and how to become one.
  4. How to see the beauty within you.
  5. The questions to help you get closer to your true self.

 

Connect with Stephanie Raffelock:

https://www.byline-stephanie.com/

https://www.instagram.com/byline.stephanie/

Creatrix Rising by Stephanie Raffelock

Art In The Time of Unbearable Crisis by Stephanie Raffelock

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 258 Leadership Qualities, Loving Your Career + Upskilling with Invited MBA COO Megan Fanale
item.itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 258 Leadership Qualities, Loving Your Career + Upskilling with Invited MBA COO Megan Fanale
item.description:
Are you loving your career?

 

This week Ash talks with Megan Fanale, the COO of Invited MBA, a part-time virtual mini-MBA program that fits your busy schedule and can help advance your career. Megan is here to share career tools to foster leadership qualities within yourself and create a career you love.

 

If you are considering making a shift in your career, Ash and Megan talk through the mindset that may be what you need to hear to feel confident making a shift. A step back might actually be a step forward for you!

 

Most programs teach presentation skills, but not too many teach you how to listen. Tune in to learn the impact of learning how to listen and the tools to use your listening capacity to become a leader in your workforce and life. This episode is here if you are ready to grow your career and build a life more aligned with your dream vision. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to create a career you love.
  2. How to leverage small programs for career advancement.
  3. Unique tools for career growth.
  4. Energy management tools when your day is full. 

 

Invited MBA:

Looking for a career boost to learn new skills and get ahead? 

 

The Invited MBA is a 12-week, part-time mini-MBA program created for working professionals. Develop essential business skills, practice your people leadership, and gain real-world experience that you can leverage to get ahead in your career. 

 

Request an application now at invitedmba.com. Mention the YouTurn podcast and get a $200 off tuition credit when you apply!

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 256 Preventative Aging Treatments 101 with Dr. Lanna Cheuck
item.itunes:title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 256 Preventative Aging Treatments 101 with Dr. Lanna Cheuck
item.description:
What are you doing for your aging process?

 

This week, Ash steps into the wellness world with Dr. Lanna Cheuck, a Celebrity Surgeon, Master trainer, and CEO of LC Medical Spa to discuss preventative aging treatments and how to age with grace and ease.

 

Dr. Lanna shares the medical history of botox, what it is composed of and whether it is dangerous for your body. If you have been questioning getting botox, fillers, vampire facials, or any other med spa treatment, here is where all of your answers can be answered by a medical professional. 

 

Ash and Dr. Lanna talk through the rejuvenation options available, what budget you may need, and what they are best for. If aging and the idea of trying a rejuvenating procedure are on the forefront of your mind, this episode is a must-listen!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The truths behind botox and fillers– what they are made of, the side effects, and the health benefits of these components.
  2. How to properly vet a medical spa and receive quality support.
  3. How to navigate a career shift.
  4. When to get liquid facelifts, vampire facials, and RPR injections.

 

Where You Can Find Dr. Lanna Cheuck

www.doctorlanna.com
www.facemedstore.com
  
INSTAGRAM:
@doctorlanna
@lcmedicalspa
@injaketor
@cynthia.aesthetic.pa

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 255 The Mark Divine Show Host Mark Divine Discusses The Science of Motivation
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 255 The Mark Divine Show Host Mark Divine Discusses The Science of Motivation
item.description:
Where in your life do you need more motivation?

 

In this bonus episode, Ash shares The Mark Divine Show podcast where host Mark Divine discusses the science of motivation. 

 

Mark Divine is the host of The Mark Divine Show, where he discovers what makes today's most inspirational, self-aware, and exponential leaders think and act so differently.

 

In this episode, Mark speaks with social psychologist, Aylet Fishbach about the science of motivation and how to set better goals.

 

Ayelet Fishbach, Ph.D., is the Jeffrey Breakenridge Keller Professor of Behavioral Science and Marketing at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, and the past president of the Society for the Study of Motivation and the International Social Cognition Network (ISCON). She is an expert on motivation and decision-making and the author of Get it Done: Surprising Lessons from the Science of Motivation. 

 

Mark Divine and Dr. Fishbach speak about how to set goals that are enforced by our intrinsic motivation, how to analyze our goals and evaluate how well they are working, and why it’s crucial to have people in your life who want you to succeed.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn

  1. The power of motivation and how to use this to work towards your goals.
  2. How to end negative habits and start adding positive actions into your life.
  3. Tools to setting goals that you can actually fulfill.
  4. The value of a support system and how to build one around you to help you win.

 

Where You Can Find Mark Divine:

The Mark Divine Show

Connect with Mark Divine on Twitter

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep 254 Optimize Your Health and Heal Digestion with Wade Lightheart
item.itunes:title: [WELLNESS] Ep 254 Optimize Your Health and Heal Digestion with Wade Lightheart
item.description:
How healthy do you think you are?

 

This week author, athlete, nutritionist, an expert on fixing digestion, and the Co-Founder and President of BiOptimizers, a health and performance optimization company. Wade is here to share insight into how to improve your digestion and optimize your health.

 

With the growth of comparison through social media, people are focused deeply on aesthetic health, but this focus can lead to being internally unhealthy. Wade shares how he shifted his intention from being visually fit to being truly healthy. Tune in to learn insight and how to get the most traction on your health, within the time and resources you have.

 

Wade is a wealth of knowledge and shares how to use supplements to your advantage, improve your digestion and optimize your daily living.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between a cosmetic vision of health and true health.
  2. The Awesome Health philosophy.
  3. What 5 stages of digestion.
  4. The ONE thing you can do to improve your digestion.
  5. Why the products you use might not be helping your digestion and wellness.
  6. The power of magnesium for sleep, digestion, and overall health. 

 

Resources

Your Bodies Many Cries for Water by F. Batmanghelidj 

magbreakthrough.com/youturn10

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 253 How Are You, Really? with Jenna Kutcher
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 253 How Are You, Really? with Jenna Kutcher
item.description:
How are you, really?

 

This week, Ash is excited to introduce you to your new digital marketing best friend, host of the Goal Digger podcast, author, and the one helping us ask better questions, Jenna Kutcher. Jenna is here to dig into what it looks like to connect to yourself, create fulfillment, and have ease in your life. Her debut book, “How Are You, Really?” releases June 28th! Pre-order now at howareyoureallybook.com

 

Suicide is high, mental health is low, and every 5 years a skillset becomes obsolete…it can feel like a never-ending hamster wheel to keep up with the world and your life. So what do you do, and where do you even begin? In this episode, Jenna shares how to begin this process and get into alignment with your truth. 

 

Jenna and Ash dive into how to course-correct the narrative of how you view your body, create more vibrancy within your life, come back to loving yourself and so much more! Enjoy!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The value of ease, and how it can lead you to more success in life.
  2. How to fully embrace moments of rest if you are an overachiever and constant doer.
  3. A pathway to feeling your feelings more fully.
  4. How to handle rejection and judgment when you take action.

 

Where You Can Find Jenna Kutcher:

The Gold Digger Podcast

How Are You, Really? By Jenna Kutcher

howareyoureallybook.com

 

Get a copy of Jenna’s new Book for FREE!

Share this episode on Instagram, Tag both @ashley.stahl and @jennakutcher for a chance to win your own copy.

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 252 How to Have Vibrant Skin and Reduce Aging with Michael Zenn
item.itunes:title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 252 How to Have Vibrant Skin and Reduce Aging with Michael Zenn
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What is your skin telling you?

 

This week, Ash steps into the wellness category to discuss your skin, the largest organ in your body. And to have this conversation she talks with Michael Zenn, the creator, and founder of Herbal Facefood, the most potent Anti-Aging, Multi-Correction, Anti-Viral skincare product on the market, and author of the book The Self Help Revolution.

 

Michael shares what aging actually is…hint it’s oxidation. But what does this mean for your skin and your body? In this episode, Michael breaks down what is happening to your body and how you can help slow this process and reduce the effects of aging. 

 

Anti-aging isn’t only about what you put on your skin, it's what you put in your body. Michael and Ash talk through what products to use for your skin, what foods to eat and what to avoid to optimize your health and reduce aging. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. 10 most visible signs of aging, and how to prevent them.
  2. What is happening to your body and skin as you live longer.
  3. What to avoid putting on your skin for overall health. 
  4. What foods to eat to support your skin and anti-aging. 



Resources:

The Self Help Revolution by Michael Zenn

 

Where to Find Michael Zenn and Herbal Facefood:

Herbal Facefood (use code ASHLEY20 for 20% off your order)

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 251 How to Create Belonging in Your Life with Janne Robinson
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 251 How to Create Belonging in Your Life with Janne Robinson
item.description:
This week Ash talks with Janne Robinson, a poet, columnist, and activist all about how to create your own sense of belonging. 

 

The rise of loneliness has become more prevalent. But on the opposite side of loneliness is belonging. If you are working through feeling alone, this episode is for you. Janne and Ash share their process for feeling whole and creating a sense of belonging in their life.

 

One powerful tool for belonging is through creativity. Janne shares her creative process, the power of allowing creativity to guide you to your truth, and what joy can come from living a creative life.

This is a poetic episode filled with insights on how to get in touch with your voice and thoughts. Enjoy!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Ways to view belonging within the world of creativity and business.
  2. How to face the truth when you are numbing or avoiding what is.
  3. The power of living in the grey in order to live an optimized life.
  4. The power of finding your own creative process to build belonging within yourself.

 

Where you can Find Janne Robinson

https://www.jannerobinson.com/

This Is For The Women Who Don’t Give a Fuck by Janne Robinson

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 250 Creating Confidence Podcast Host Heather Monahan Shares How to Unearth and Transform Your Limiting Beliefs
item.description:
What if you could uncover all the beliefs that are holding you back? 

 

We all carry limiting beliefs that can make us anxious, judgemental, and self-conscious but they don’t have to control your life. You can heal them by starting with the simple idea: You Are Enough. 

 

In this bonus episode, Certified Clinical Hypnotherapist, Certified NLP Practitioner, and Advanced Rapid Transformational Therapist, Heather David, comes onto the show to walk you through how to start that journey. Heather David is a one-of-a-kind teacher who has the power to change your life. 

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. Tools to support you in accepting that you are enough.
  2. Guidance on how to heal yourself from past experiences.
  3. The formula for confidence.

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 248 How to Discover Yourself and Own Your Self Esteem With Iman Oubou
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 248 How to Discover Yourself and Own Your Self Esteem With Iman Oubou
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

This week Ash talks to Iman Oubou a Moroccan-American entrepreneur, former Miss New York, the funder of Swaay Media, and author of the new book The Glass Ledge.

 

If you feel limitations in your life, Iman’s story is filled with breaking beyond limitations, but not necessarily the ones you may think. Iman shares the perspective that the most important glass ceilings are the ones we impose on ourselves. 

 

This episode is filled with insightful questions that will help you understand your relationship to power, step into your natural confidence and feel capable of taking actionable steps towards your dreams. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to shift the narrative in your mind to believe in yourself.
  2. Tools to step away from victimhood as a woman and focus on what you CAN do.
  3. How to remove the limitations that are holding you back from living the life you want.
  4. Questions to ask yourself to understand your relationship with power.

 

Where You Can Find Iman Oubou:

https://www.instagram.com/imanoubou/?hl=en

https://theglassledge.com/

https://swaay.com/

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 247 Unmistakable Creative Podcast Host Srinivas Rao Shares How To Live and Die Well
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 247 Unmistakable Creative Podcast Host Srinivas Rao Shares How To Live and Die Well
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you living well?

 

In this bonus episode, Ash shares the Unmistakable Creative podcast where host Srinivas Rao discusses how to live and die well. 

 

Srinivas Rao is the host and founder of the Unmistakable Creative podcast, where he’s interviewed more than 1000 people ranging from bank robbers to billionaires. His self-published book The Art of Being Unmistakable was a Wall Street Journal bestseller and he was featured on the Netflix documentary, Indian Matchmaking.

 

This episode is packed with insights and actionable advice on how to improve your daily life and shift your perspective into a state of continual joy. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Why iconic figures may not be the best role models, and who is.
  2. Why you should create a standard of excellence in every area of your life
  3. Tools to overcome circumstances within your environment.
  4. How to leverage grit and talent for success.

Where to Find Srinivas Rao:

Subscribe to the Unmistakable Creative Podcast on iTunes or Your Favorite Podcast App

Twitter: @unmistakableceo

Instagram: @unmistakablecreative

Website: http://www.unmistakablecreative.com

Resources:

item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 246 How to Tap Into Your Intuition and Live Vibrantly with Jen Riday
item.description:
This week, Ash talks with Jen Riday all about how to follow your intuition and set clear boundaries. 

 

Jen is not only a successful entrepreneur and podcast host, she is a mother to 6 children. And has mastered how to set boundaries not only within her work life but also between her work and family life. If you are struggling with how to say no or where to limit your availability, Jen and Ash walk through how to set clear boundaries for yourself.

 

If you are feeling stuck and aren't sure how to clear with what you want, this episode is filled with actionable tools you can apply daily to lift the fog on your life and bring you into a state of calm and clarity. Be sure to tune!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to set boundaries with others, and with yourself.
  2. Actionable tips to hone in on following your intuition.
  3. How to view challenging times from a new perspective. 
  4. Ways to create emotional safety and regulate your emotions.

 

Resources:

Chatter by Ethan Kross

 

Jen Riday:

item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

This week Ash steps into the work category with Jordan Karcher the founder of Grounds & Hounds Coffee company to discuss how to start a side hustle. And not just any side hustle…Jordan is here to share how to be successful in building an e-commerce company. 

 

If you have dreams of starting a business or are looking for tips on how to expand your career and business skillset, Jordan shares valuable insight. Ash and Jordan talk about selling to strangers, building a belief mindset, and how to overcome to pitfalls of business ownership. 

 

For all the entrepreneurs and dreams…this episode is for YOU!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

item.title: [Bonus] Ep. 244 Make Some Noise Podcast Host Andrea Owen Talks with Ashley on How to Get Unstuck and Uncover Your Career Direction
item.itunes:title: [Bonus] Ep. 244 Make Some Noise Podcast Host Andrea Owen Talks with Ashley on How to Get Unstuck and Uncover Your Career Direction
item.description:
Do you know your top skill set?

 

This week, Ash shares a bonus episode that is very unique to the show. The tables are turned and Ashley is actually being interviewed by Make Some Noise Podcast host Andrea Owen.

 

Andrea and Ash cover a wide range of topics relating to career, including why people get stuck or feel stuck in their jobs, the top ten career skill sets, and why you should do what you are, instead of what you love. 

 

This episode ends with a mic drop quote, one of which we could all be reminded of, “Who you are, always wins.” 

 

In this episode you’ll learn:

  1. Why people get so stuck in their career and commonplace directive of “follow your passion”.
  2. The top 10 core skill sets and why you need to know which one you possess. 
  3. How to figure out your core values and why these values matter for your career. 
  4. Advice for people who are in careers they love, but the organization’s leadership is less than desirable. 
  5. Thoughts about the 9-5 work schedule seen in the U.S. and how it may not be in service for everyone.
  6. The myths people buy into in their careers. 

 

Resources mentioned in this episode:

Make Some Noise by Andrea Owen is coming on August 31st! 

Learn more at: AndreaOwen.com/noise

 

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 243 Eliminate Perfectionism w/Dr. Margaret Rutherford
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 243 Eliminate Perfectionism w/Dr. Margaret Rutherford
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Where do you become perfectionistic?

 

This week, Ash sits down with Dr. Margaret Rutherford a psychotherapist, author, and podcast host to work through eliminating perfectionism and overcoming perfectly hidden depression. 

 

If you have perfectionist tendencies, Margaret walks through where this behavior stems from, how to recognize this behavior and the tools to move out of perfection and back into living.

 

Dr. Margaret and Ash talk about the connection between perfection and trauma. This episode holds insight on brain spotting, EMDR, and other modalities people can turn to for support in releasing trauma. 

 

Dr. Margaret shares what classic/clinical depression is and how to reverse this experience. Margaret defines depression as energy imploding inward. So, how do you get this energy to move up and out?…tune in to learn more!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The benefits of EMDR are to release trauma and move away from perfection related to trauma.
  2. 10 traits of perfectly hidden depression
  3. 5 stages of healing from depression
  4. Practices to step into a deeper level of self-acceptance

 

Where to Find Dr. Margaret Rutherford:

SelfWork Podcast

Perfectly Hidden Depression by Dr. Margaret Rutherford

https://drmargaretrutherford.com/



Resources:

Want an EMDR Certified Therapst? Contact Nicole Nowparvar nnowparvar@gmail.com

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 242 Ever Forward Podcast Host Chase Chewning talks with Sukhinder Singh Cassidy on How to Take Risks and Thrive Even When You Fail
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 242 Ever Forward Podcast Host Chase Chewning talks with Sukhinder Singh Cassidy on How to Take Risks and Thrive Even When You Fail
item.description:
Have you ever felt like you’ve made the wrong career choice? Are you waiting for the right time or the best opportunity to come along so you can take the leap towards your dream life?

On this weeks Bonus episode, Ash highlights the Ever Forward Podcast with host Chase Chewning. 

Chase sits down with Sukhinder Singh Cassidy an author, entrepreneur, and CEO, who has a unique perspective to share with those of you who are afraid of making the wrong career choice or have an unhealthy relationship with risk.  

She says that “even when we think we have a failure from which we’ll never recover, there’s still another move, there’s still five more choices to be made.”

Your potential for receiving life’s rewards isn’t limited. Don’t get caught up in the one thing that might make you successful in life. Get committed to the process. Put progress over perfection and turn risks into opportunities. This is your time to choose possibility!

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  • Risk-taking myths that cause fear and hinder us from achieving greatness.
  • Sukhinder gives you a peek into her experience with failure, success and taking risks as a CEO and entrepreneur.
  • Is it healthy to make decisions and take risks, especially in your career, based on a specific timeline? 
  • Sukhinder shares her thoughts on how to thrive through ownership & How to have a proactive relationship with risk management.
  • The power of surrounding yourself with the right people to foster appropriate risk-taking and thrive in life and at work.

Where You Can Find the Ever Forward Podcast:

https://chasechewning.com/

Ever Forward Podcast

 

SOUL CBD

 

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 241 How to Stop People-Pleasing and Start Speaking Up w/ Amy Green Smith
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 241 How to Stop People-Pleasing and Start Speaking Up w/ Amy Green Smith
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you a people-pleaser?

 

In this week's episode, Ash invites Amy Green Smith onto the show to discuss how to stop people-pleasing, and start speaking up for yourself. Amy is a certified hypnotherapist, speaker, and personal empowerment expert here to help you step into your power.

 

If you feel fear about speaking up, Amy offers a strategy on how you can become more confident in sharing your thoughts and breaks down what may be holding you back. Ash and Amy talk through the challenges and implications of chronic people-pleasing and how to tell if you are stuck in this behavior. No matter how often you find yourself overly giving to others, this episode will offer actionable tips on how to set boundaries for yourself and step into alignment with your truth!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The connection between resentment and boundaries
  2. The truth behind what people-pleasing is.
  3. Signs you may be a people pleaser.
  4. 4 primitive responses to fear

 

Where You Can Connect with Amy Green Smith

https://amygreensmith.com/

The Bold Faced Truth Podcast

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 240 Building a Healthy Partnership w/Nicole Nowparvar
item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 240 Building a Healthy Partnership w/Nicole Nowparvar
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!   Are you a healthy partner?   This week, Ash sits down with long-time bestie, Nicole Nowparvar who is a licensed psychotherapist and life coach here to support a conversation around being a healthy partner and having a healthy relationship.

 

Nicole and Ash open up this conversation by sharing the 3 qualities of a healthy partner and what this looks like. If you are dating someone, or in a relationship, here is a chance to step back and reflect on whether your person embodies these qualities.

 

Commitment is a skill. If you haven’t learned it, or are looking to improve this part of yourself Ash and Nicole talk through how to build this skill set. This episode is packed with relationship tips on how to navigate being in a relationship with someone who has a personality disorder, identify gaslighting, and set boundaries. This episode is a roadmap to healthy relationships, you don’t want to miss this!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The 3 qualities of a healthy partner.

item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How do you feel when you walk into a room full of strangers?

 

This week Ash talks with Harry Santa-Olalla a business owner and auctioneer and fundraising consultant who is here to share how to have more charisma and step into a room ready to own the space with grace.

 

Presence CAN be built, and Harry is here to help you build confidence and feel comfortable in the spotlight. If you struggle to give a presentation, talk with strangers or even give a best man/maid of honor speech, tune in to learn how to overcome this fear.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to build confidence and be comfortable with public speaking.
  2. Tools and mindset shifts to take when under public pressure.

item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep.238 Tools For Regulating Your Emotions and Mental Chatter with Ethan Kross
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

This week, Ash steps into the mindset category for a conversation all about regulating emotions with Ethan Kross. Ethan is one of the world's leading experts on controlling the conscious mind. An award-winning professor at the University of Michigan and best-selling author of the book Chatter.

 

Our internal chatter is filled with different thoughts and patterns. Whether you suffer from Imposter syndrome, catastrophizing, or angry thoughts, Ethan shares tools to break free from these thoughts. 

 

This episode is packed with research-backed insights, dynamic stories, and actionable tools to shift your thoughts and regulate your emotional wellbeing.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Tools for how to shift the way you speak to yourself.
  2. How to break mental patterns that are holding you back.
  3. The impact of mental chatter on attention.
  4. Workplace gossip…how to navigate this and stay positive in stressful work life.

 

Resources:

The Untethered Soul by Michael Stinger

 

Where To Find Ethan Kross:

https://www.ethankross.com/

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 237 SelfWork Podcast Host Dr. Margarete Rutherford Discusses Trauma bonding: When Trust Is Manipulated and Destroyed
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 237 SelfWork Podcast Host Dr. Margaret Rutherford Discusses Trauma bonding: When Trust Is Manipulated and Destroyed
item.description:
Have you ever been in a relationship where you don’t feel trust?

 

Here is a special bonus episode highlighting one of Ashley’s favorite resources, the SelfWork Podcast hosted by Dr. Margaret Rutherford. In this featured episode, Dr. Margaret shares insight on all aspects of trauma bonding and what this may mean for your relationship.

 

Trauma bonding happens when trust is highly manipulated; when commitment and trying to make a relationship work are used against someone as a way to keep them in denial or disbelief that a relationship is harmful to them. In this episode, Dr. Margaret Rutherford walks through how to notice if you are in a relationship like this, how to get out, and ways to heal from trauma bonding. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What trauma bond is.
  2. How trauma bonding forms.
  3. Ways in which trauma bonding can show up in a romantic relationship and why this dynamic can be so impactful on the success of a relationship.

Where To Find Dr. Margaret Rutherford:

 

SelfWork Podcast with Dr. Margaret Rutherford

https://drmargaretrutherford.com/

 

Resources:

John Kim, aka The Angry Therapist provides an article on trauma bonding

 

A BBC article on Stockholm syndrome

 

An  article in VeryWellMind.discusses features of covert narcissism

 

Sponsor:

 

Soul CBD

Here is something just for you to sleep more deeply, reduce stress and heal anxiety. 

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/soul and use the code YOUTURN at checkout for 15% off your order!

item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 236 How To Improve Your Intimacy and Pleasure with Alicia Davon
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How satisfied are you with your intimacy in relationships?

 

This week Ash talks with Alicia Davon on all things pleasure. Alicia holds a Master's degree in Integral Psychology with a focus on women's romantic and sensual expression. She is an extended orgasm teacher and the founder of the Davon Method here to help you create the relationship, and intimacy, of your dreams.

 

Alicia shares reasons why a relationship may have lost its intimacy and spark and how to reconnect and build passion back into the relationship. Alicia and Ash dive into the psychological and health issues centered around sexuality and intimacy for both men and women.

 

If you have been struggling to orgasm, build more intimacy in your relationship, or are looking to expand your access to pleasure in life, this episode is filled with juicy insights for you!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to overcome the common relationship challenges in regards to pleasure.
  2. Erectile dysfunction: why it happens and how a couple can work through this.
  3. What to consider if you are curious about entering into an open relationship.
  4. Tools to expand pleasure in your love life.
  5. The phases of a relationship and what to work through within each.

 

Where to Connect with Alicia Davon:

https://erwandavon.com/

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 234 How To Optimize Your Nutrition with Max Lugavere
item.itunes:title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 234 How To Optimize Your Nutrition with Max Lugavere
item.description:
How would you rate your diet today?

 

This week, Ash talks with Max Lugavere, a filmmaker, health and science journalist, New York Times best-seller and host of the #1 iTunes health podcast The Genius Life.

 

Max and Ashley debunk nutrition and diet trends out there, how to improve your diet, and what is the secret behind superfoods. Max is a wealth of nutritional knowledge and shares insights on how to properly season food, how to cook foods for nutrition consumption and so much more.

 

This is the food episode filled with nuggets of knowledge you didn’t even know you needed to learn. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The impact of processed food on fertility, health, and disease prevention. 
  2. How to enhance your performance at work every day through the food you eat. 
  3. Proper cookware care to prevent harmful cooking.
  4. The true superfoods of the supermarket, and how to find affordable nutrients.
  5. What to consider with food sensitivities, lactose intolerance, and gluten sensitivity.

 

Where to Find Max Lugavere

https://www.maxlugavere.com/

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep.233 4 Steps To Overcome Loss with Kelsey Chittick
item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep.233 4 Steps To Overcome Loss with Kelsey Chittick
item.description:
This Week Ash talks to Kelsey Chittick a writer, comedian, and co-host of the KeepOn Podcast who is an expert on death and loss. Tune in to learn the 4 steps to overcome loss and move through grief in grace.

 

Kelsey shares her story of losing her husband suddenly and how this painful experience taught her how to navigate painful experiences and is here to share this wisdom with you. Ash and Kelsey walk through how to support yourself, and others during times of grief, how to tap into your intuition and find joy in life again. 

 

If you have lost someone or something you loved or want to be prepared when you do, this raw and insightful conversation is here for you.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to support others when they are going through loss.
  2. Indicators of whether you are experiencing Intuition or fear.
  3. 4 steps to heal from loss.
  4. Tools to release grief from your mind and body.

 

Resources:

The Code of the Extraordinary Mind by Vishen Lakhiani 

The Big Leap by Gary Hendricks

 

Where You Can Find Kelsey Chittick

Keep On Podcast

item.title: [BONUS] Ep. 232 Intentional Advantage Podcast with Host Tanya Dalton on How to Set the Right Goals
item.itunes:title: [BONUS] Ep. 232 Intentional Advantage Podcast with Host Tanya Dalton on How to Set the Right Goals
item.description:
The biggest mistake people make with their goals is that they don’t set the right goals. Let me phrase that: They don’t set the right goals for themselves. There’s no magic list of goals you need to complete in order to be successful. 

Goals should be personalized and customized so they are in alignment with your purpose. In today’s episode, we’ll talk about how you discover your purpose and how to set goals that are aligned with the vision you have for your future. It’s time to stop living life on repeat and step into the extraordinary life you were designed to live.

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  • Why The Extraordinary Life is possible for you.
  • What goals should I be setting?
  • The biggest secret about setting goals to save you from burnout.
  • Why we need to stop trying harder.
  • Why you are already “wired” for success.
  • How you make big goals feel easier.
  • How Cathedral Thinking helps you discover your goals.
  • Taking off your backpack.
  • How you can break down your big vision into goals using wayfinding.

item.content:encoded:
The biggest mistake people make with their goals is that they don’t set the right goals. Let me phrase that: They don’t set the right goals for themselves. There’s no magic list of goals you need to complete in order to be successful.  Goals should be personalized and customized so they are in alignment with your purpose. In today’s episode, we’ll talk about how you discover your purpose and how to set goals that are aligned with the vision you have for your future. It’s time to stop living life on repeat and step into the extraordinary life you were designed to live. In This Episode, You’ll Learn:
  • Why The Extraordinary Life is possible for you.
  • What goals should I be setting?
  • The biggest secret about setting goals to save you from burnout.
  • Why we need to stop trying harder.
  • Why you are already “wired” for success.
  • How you make big goals feel easier.
  • How Cathedral Thinking helps you discover your goals.
  • Taking off your backpack.
  • How you can break down your big vision into goals using wayfinding.
 

Connect with Tanya:

If you are interested in doing a one-on-one VIP Day with Tanya, go to TanyaDalton.com/VIP

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 231 How to Navigate the Dating Scene with Bela Gandhi
item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 231 How to Navigate the Dating Scene with Bela Gandhi
item.description:
Are you struggling to succeed in the dating world?

 

This week Ash brings Bela Gandhi founder of the Smart Dating Academy back onto the podcast to help everyone navigate how to date successfully and connect with a partner that is right for you.

 

Red flags, issues, and misalignment are easy to overlook in the beginning of dating someone new and exciting. Here is your space to learn how to notice potential problems, and on the flip side…be able to tell if someone is a good fit for you.

 

Bela shares a golden rule for how long to date before becoming exclusive, how to navigate texting a partner or new date and ways to date virtually and so much more. If you are looking for a partner, this episode is for you!

 

In this Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How to navigate pacing and when is it too fast to enter into a relationship.
  2. Signs and indicators you are dating a narcissist or involved in love bombing.
  3. What is a red flag, versus a yellow flag to notice when dating.
  4. How to navigate dating someone with an addiction.

 

Where To Find Bela Gandhi

Smart Dating Academy Podcast

@smartdatingacademy

https://www.smartdatingacademy.com/

item.description:

This week, Ash talks with MaryEllen Reider is the co-director of Yarlap, the wellness device to treat urinary incontinence and improve sexual performance and experience through muscle control.

 

If you, or your partner, has experienced incontinence MaryEllen is here to provide guidance on why this may be and how to improve your pelvic floor strength. Ash and MaryEllen discuss hacks to improve your sexual performance, amply your pelvic floor health, and feel better in your body.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 229 The Future of Flexibility at Work with Ellen Kossek
item.itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 229 The Future of Flexibility at Work with Ellen Kossek
item.description:
Ellen Kossek is a Professor at Purdue and a leading US social scientist on work, family, and employment issues. Ellen sheds light on the future of flexibility at work and what that means for the future of your career. 

 

With the great resignation, working from home and major shifts in the workforce, the future may look uncertain. Ellen and Ash talk through how to use this time of change to your career advantage, how to have a flexible career that works specifically for you, and tools to expand your career trajectory while maintaining peace in your personal life.

 

If you want to take advantage of the future and have the flexible career you crave don’t miss this episode!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to thrive in the future of your career during this time of change.
  2. 3 key reasons employers should shift into a more flexible work model- and how you can capitalize on this.
  3. How to collaborate with your coworkers to create working environments that maximize your idea workflow.
  4. Tools to set 
  5. How to get a raise and promotion, even when working remotely.

 

Where To Connect to Ellen Kossek:

Ellenkossek.com

item.itunes:title: [MINDSET] Ep. 228 Finding the Extraordinary in the Ordinary with Agapi Stassinopoulos
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

This week Ash brings a dear friend Agapi Stassinopoulos back onto the show for a special episode all about the extraordinary moments in life. Agapi Stassinopoulos is an author and speaker here to share how to more closely connect with spirit and the magic of life.

 

If you are feeling disconnected and want to figure out what to do with your life, Agapi and Ash share the small moments that make the biggest impact for creating the world you want to live within. 

 

Agapi and Ash dive into connections with healing, spirituality, and how to truly embrace living in the present with peace. This episode is filled with warmth, love, and depth, it's a message for your soul to feel into. Don’t miss this!



In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to experience more pleasure and moments in life.
  2. Tips to start the day for creating a powerful and connected way.
  3. Self-soothing tools to bring you into a grounded state.
  4. How to relate to bad news.

Get her new book: Speaking with Spirit

item.itunes:title: [LOVE] Ep. 226 RELATIONSHIP DYNAMICS: New relationships, stale relationships + how to set yourself up for success with Dr. Eva Brown
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!  

This week Ash talks with Dr. Eva Brown, a couples and intimacy specialist, cybernetician, and an emotiontologist all about relationship dynamics.

 

Dr. Eva and Ash walk through how to navigate the dating world, tips for successfully entering into a new relationship, and how to bring aliveness back into a long-term relationship. If you think you need a refresh in your relationship or you are dating and want help on finding someone special, there is so much in this episode for you!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to set yourself up for success in a relationship.
  2. Questions to ask someone to understand if they are right for you.
  3. 5 stages to conscious relationship mapping.
  4. How to respond when someone says they love you, but you aren’t there yet.
  5. Communication tools to support one another, and get what you want.

item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you know what the ingredients of your favorite wine or cocktail are?

 

This week, Ash sits down with the CEO and founder of Dry Farm Wines, Todd White to discuss drinking consciously. Todd is here to share insight into the wine industry, what is happening to you when you consume alcohol and how to enjoy a drink while being conscious of your health. Cheers! 🍷

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What biohacking is, and how it influences our health.
  2. Two main causes of chronic disease and natural ways to reduce your risk.
  3. The impact of agriculture on wine, laws that impact alcohol, and the truth behind the alcohol industry.
  4. Beneficial properties of red wine (polyphenols). 
  5. The 3 components that make wine natural.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 223 Overcome Imposter Syndrome and Own Your Education with Luke Owings
item.itunes:title: [WORK] Ep. 223 Overcome Imposter Syndrome and Own Your Education with Luke Owings
item.description:
Luke Owings is the VP of Product at Abilite a company dedicated to providing accessible business learning to as many people as possible. Luke is here to help you transition into a new career with confidence, overcome imposter syndrome and determine whether higher education is the next step in your career. 

 

Imposter syndrome often leads to seeking more education, more work, and…more stress. Luke and Ash talk through how to navigate all these areas of your work life and come out on top. You don’t want to miss this episode!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. One of the most valuable skill sets to develop today.
  2. How to navigate the workforce whether you are an introvert or an extrovert.
  3. Ways to boost energy to have a present workday.
  4. Factors to help combat and overcome imposter syndrome.
  5. Key career connections to make for your career growth.

 

Invited MBA:

Looking for a career boost to learn new skills and get ahead? 

 

The Invited MBA is a 12-week, part-time mini-MBA program created for working professionals. Develop essential business skills, practice your people leadership, and gain real-world experience that you can leverage to get ahead in your career. 

 

The next cohort starts on March 8 – apply before February 18, 2022, to be eligible for scholarships of up to $1,000. Visit  invitedMBA.com to learn more.

 

ORGANIFI

 

Want to upgrade your health? Visit organifi.com/youturn and enter code YOUTURN to get 20% off at check out! 

 

SANEBOX 

 

Tired of digging through your inbox to find the emails you actually want to read?

 

Sign up for Sanebox at  https://www.sanebox.com/youturn

It is time to feel sane when you open your mail!

 

Click on this exclusive link to automatically get a $25 credit applied to your account AND get a 14-day FREE trial.

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 222 Mold 101: What Mold Is, Where It Is and How To Heal with Mike Rubino
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Are you often tired, but don't know why?

 

Step into caring about your wellness today to learn about a niche, yet vital aspect of health: mold exposure. 

 

Ash brings on mold expert, Mike Rubino to discuss mold-related illnesses, where they exist, and how to recover from mold exposure. Mike shares various ways you can tell if your home or workplace is impacted by mold, what to do if you discover mold in your home, and ways to protect yourself from it moving forward.

 

If you suffer from brain fog, exhaustion, or allergy-related symptoms, you might be affected by mold. Tune in for this informative episode that will uplevel your wellness today!



In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to identify if there is mold in your home.
  2. How mold grows and ways to remove it.
  3. Foods that are more susceptible to mold, and how to tell if you shouldn’t eat them.
  4. Symptoms of mold in your body.



Where You Can Find Mike Rubino

@themoldmedic

https://www.themoldmedic.com/



Purity Coffee 

Visit https://puritycoffee.com/ and use code ASHLEY for 20% off your order!

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 221 Career Planning in 2022: Trends + Tips with Mark Herschberg
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you have a career plan for your future?

 

This week Ash talks with Mark Herschberg an author and professor from MIT all about how to build a career plan and execute on this vision. 

 

Mark and Ash dive straight into all things career: what to consider when creating a plan in the new year, formal tools on negotiation, and the single tip for authentic networking (it isn’t what you would think!)

 

If you are ready for a career shift in the new year or want to continue to grow in your current role, Mark shares valuable insights, you don’t want to miss. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Whether job-hopping is a fit for your current career path or not.
  2. The tools to build a career plan for your year ahead.
  3. How to overcome Zoom fatigue and enjoy virtual work again.
  4. Networking insights to build deep relationships.
  5. What a peer learning group is and what you will gain by joining one.

 

Where You Can Find Mark Herschberg

The Career Toolkit by Mark Herschberg

Check out the Career Toolkit App

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 220 The Science of Being Stuck + Practices to Get Grounded with Victoria Albina
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Where in your life do you feel stuck?

 

This week, Ash brings Victoria Albina, a functional medicine expert, breathwork facilitator, and podcast host onto the show to share the science behind being stuck in life and how to use natural tools to break free. 

 

Victoria walks through somatic practices to help you feel more grounded, the background on your physical responses to the world, and how to tap into your body in order to make big changes. 

 

Tune in for actionable practices to help regulate your emotions, thought work based on cognitive behavioral therapy to shift your mindset and so much more! Ash and Victoria dive deep and have lots of laughs along the way, you don’t want to miss out on this one.

 

Resources:

Codependent No More by Melody Beattie



In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Easy somatic practices to get more grounded.
  2. Scientific background to your physical body and emotional life.
  3. How to no longer feel stuck in your life. 
  4. Ways to overcome codependency.
  5. The link between perfectionism and gut issues and nervous system regulation.

 

Where You Can Find Victoria Albina:

Feminist Wellness Podcast

https://victoriaalbina.com/

@victoriaalbinawellness

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 219 New Year, New You: A Financial Wellness Tune-Up with Sallie Krawcheck
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How often do you look at your finances?

 

This week, Ash has a unique conversation about finances with Sallie Krawcheck, the CEO of Ellevest a financial platform created by women, for women. 

 

This is a finance episode beyond a money mindset, Sallie and Ash cover how to make sure you are financially well, tips to overcome the confidence gap and explore the impact of COVID on the future of your finances and career.

 

Whether you are walking into the New Year ready to grow your finances and investments or you are looking for ways to improve your finances and start saving, the insight in this conversation is a must-listen!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to balance living well and living financially healthy. 
  2. Ways to see money in abundance instead of scarcity.
  3. Steps to building a financial plan for your current state and future state of living. 
  4. The value of discussing money, and how to have conversations about your finances.
  5. Bitcoin and the future of investing.

 

Resources:

https://www.ellevest.com/magazine

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 218 Dating Apps + Best Practices To Find Love in the New Year! With Bela Gandhi
item.description:
How much do you value partnership?

 

This week, Ash sits down with Bela Gandhi, a TEDx Speaker and founder of the Smart Dating Academy to have a conversation all about the secrets to finding lasting love. 

 

The reality is, 48% of adults in the US are single, and the majority are ready to find love. And while dating aps are everywhere, it can be overwhelming. That is why this episode is here for you. Bela breaks down dating apps, how to enter into the new age of dating and know what you want in a relationships.

 

Bela and Ash talk through creating good pacing in dating, serial monogamy, when to bring sex into the equation and how to identify red flags in a relationship. This episode is packed with insights on all things date! This episode is here for you if you want to be educated on dating and are ready to find love!

 

Resources:

Attached by Amir Levine

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. When the peak dating period begins and how to get into it.
  2. How to create an online dating site or app that works and represents you well.
  3. Tools to develop a healthy mindset to take when dating.
  4. How to identify red flags or signs of incompatability in a relationship.
  5. Why certain marriages end in divorce, and how to avoid this.

 

Where You Can Find Bela Gandhi

https://www.smartdatingacademy.com/

@smartdatingacademy

 Watch her TEDx Talk: The Secret To Finding Lasting Love
