How proud are you of the person you are right now?

 

This week, Ash talks with Steve Olsher, the founder of Podcast Magazine, chairman and founder of Liquor.com, and NY Times best-selling author and podcast host. Steve is a reinvention expert here to share seven principles that will change your life.

 

Ash and Steve share how to make clear decisions, self-care practices to remain present in the moment and tools to get unstuck from challenging moments in your life. Solutions can be simple, and Steve is here to show you how.

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 216 How To Sleep Better with Diane Macedo
item.description:
How would you rank your sleep quality?

 

This week Ash talks with Diane Macedo, an anchor and correspondent on ABC and the author of The Sleep Fix. Diane is here to share all things sleep: how to get better sleep, what is impacting your ability to rest and so much more!

 

Restless leg syndrome, sleep apnea, and narcolepsy are only a few of the sleep orders that exist. Diane walks through what the disorders are to help you if you are struggling with sleep and don’t know why.

 

Tune in to learn what to do if you snore throughout the night, wake up to pee consistently or feel restless all night long. Diane is a wealth of knowledge on one of the most vital wellness topics. You don’t want to miss out!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. 2 main internal systems that drive sleep.
  2. How your circadian rhythm is impacting your sleep.
  3. Tips to identify why you aren’t able to sleep.
  4. The impact of sleep positions on your quality of rest.
  5. What happens when you sleep with your pets. 
  6. How much sleep you actually need.

 

 

Where You Can Find Diane Macedo:

Get Her Book: The Sleep Fix

@dianermacedo

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 215 How To Set Boundaries in Relationships with Terri Cole
item.description:
Where do you need to set a boundary?

 

This week, Ash brings back onto the show Terri Cole, a NY-based Liscned Psychotherapist, relationship expert, founder of the Real Love Revolution, and author of her new book, Boundary Boss. Terri is here to talk all about setting boundaries, you don’t want to miss this!

 

Setting boundaries means you show people who you truly are, and that can be frightening. Terri shares personal stories and walks through practices for how to move beyond this fear, speak your truth, and confidently stand in your boundaries. 

 

Tune in to learn how to recognize when you are beginning to reach the edge of your boundaries, how to communicate your needs without feeling guilty or ashamed and stop being a people pleaser. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to set healthy boundaries with loved ones in your life.
  2. Methods to set boundaries that will also enable you to compromise.
  3. How to normalize hard conversations.
  4. Ways to move away from being a people-pleaser or instant yes person.

 

Where To Find Terri Cole:

Get her Book Boundary Boss

https://www.terricole.com/

boundaryboss.me/youturn

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 214 How To Be Intrapreneurial in Your Career with Hala Taha
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How valuable are you at work?

 

Join Ash in the work category this week while she talks with special guest Hala Taha all about how to be intrapreneurial in your career and create more joy in your work. Hala is the SEO of YAC media and host of the Young and Profiting podcast with an incredible story of perseverance and an example of what happens when you follow the nudges of your passions. 

 

Growing an online presence can feel like an uphill battle, forever. But, here is where Tala shares some unique and proven techniques to connect with people on social media platforms and grow a truly engaged community. 

 

Tala and Ash discuss ways to build energy, especially when you feel drained by your work, tools for standing out at your company, and creative ways to navigate a career during times of change. If you care about your career, you don’t want to miss the magic within this episode!



In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The power of following your passion.
  2. How to create a following that is actually engaged, and growing.
  3. Skill Staking - what this is and how you can develop this yourself. 
  4. Tips for building awareness within your company to boost your career. 
  5. Practices to build your confidence muscle.

 

Where You Can Find Hala Taha:

Young and Profiting Podcast

LinkedIn: Hala Taha

@yapwithhala

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 213 8 Keys to Unlock Abundance In Your Life with Brandon Beachum
item.description:
Where do you feel an opportunity for more in your life?

 

This week, Ash talks with Brandon Beachum, the host of the Positive Head Podcast, author, and entrepreneur all about how to tap into creating abundance in your life.

 

Your beliefs affect your genes. While this concept may sound a bit heavy, Brandon shares how to create what you want, instead of attract what you dislike. Your thoughts are powerful in driving your life, tune in to hear how to shifts your thoughts and step into being the person you want to become.

 

Ash and Brandon share mindset tips on how to reframe comparison, align your attention with your goals and decipher what is an illusion versus reality within your life. This is an episode filled with historical learnings, insightful quotes and ideas that will encourage you to think beyond what you see. 

 

Resources:

The Biology of Belief by Bruce Lipton

The Power of Now by Ekart Tolle

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Mindset tips to living in a state of joy and abundance.
  2. How to let go and simply...be.
  3. Ideologies to embody in order to see life from a positive perspective.
  4. How to break free from comparison and enjoy experiencing other's success.

 

Where You Can Find Brandon Beachum:

@optimystic

Check out his Podcast: https://www.positivehead.com/

Get his Book: The Golden Key

Get the book for FREE on Audible or E-book:

goldenkey.gift with code YOUTURN

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 212 Mindset Shifts To Living A Life You Love with Simon Hall
item.description:
Where does your mind stop you from taking action?

 

Simon Hall is the CEO of the Nourish Group and God Head Coffee and he helps people build brands and become a top performer. Simon is here to offer insights and mindset shifts to create your own path and feel excited while doing so.

 

Sitting still is such a simple exercise, yet sometimes it can feel impossible! If you struggle to get still and listen to your intuition, Simon shares his tools for getting clear and hearing from yourself. 

 

If you want to become a top performer and uplevel your life, Simon walks through The Core 4: the four areas of life to focus on...and they aren’t what you might think (especially #4!) This episode is packed with actionable tips, mindset shifts, and insights on how to live a healthy fulfilled life. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to become grounded and tune in to your intuition.
  2. How to decipher from your intuition and fearful thoughts.
  3. The Core 4 Areas of life to get clear on and put your focus into.
  4. How to avoid soul burnout and use health for optimal performance.

item.title: [SOULO] Ep. 211 Thoughts on processing loss
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What do you do when you are in a moment of darkness?

 

In this quick solo episode, Ash opens up about how to navigate life after loss or during a difficult time. Ash shares the impact of disassociating from your feelings, the link between connection and grief, and what to do instead of indulging in the drama of life.

 

Ash leaves you with a few powerful questions to help you face what you may be avoiding or hurting from. This is a moment for you to become closer to your truth and light.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Thoughts on how to keep going when you are struggling.
  2. The value of living in darkness in order to create a better life.
  3. The impact of disassociation from what you are feeling.

 

BIOPTIMIZER

 

Sick and tired of being sick or tired? 

 

If you want to improve your sleep quality, try Magnesium Breakthrough, the only magnesium supplement I know of that contains 7 different forms of magnesium.

Every elevate powder is made with a supercharged stack of electrolytes, and there’s never any added sugar or artificial sweeteners.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 210 How To Build Your Network with Travis Chappell
item.description:
How satisfied are you with your current network of connections?

 

This week's guest, Travis Chappell is the CEO and founder of Guestio, a software to connect guests and content creators and also the host of the show Build Your Network. Travis and Ash talk all about how to build a network, how to face job hunt rejection and so much more!

 

Do you feel like networking is a numbers game? In some ways, it can be. But, there is another approach you can take to truly build a powerful network for the long term. You don’t want to miss out on these unique career tips.

 

In the current world of social distancing and reduced in-person meetings, it might feel like building a network isn’t possible. Travis shares how he has built a truly connected network through online techniques. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Networking hacks that actually work.
  2. The benefits of having a podcast.
  3. Where to find people that will bring your life and career value.
  4. How to rise above rejection and become more confident.

 

Where You Can Find Travis Chappell

https://travischappell.com/

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 209 How To Make Better Decisions to Achieve Your Life Goals with Tanya Dalton
item.description:
Do you struggle to make decisions?

 

This week, Ash puts the focus on how to make better decisions, beat perfectionism and overcome analysis paralysis with special guest, Tanya Dalton.

 

Tanya is a productivity expert, growth strategist, and best-selling author here to share actionable tips and insight on how to get to the root of why decisions are difficult to make and how to flow more freely forward in life.

 

Our past is filled with treasure, and while you don’t want to dwell on the past, there is value to reflecting on previous experiences. Tanya shares a practice and questions to use to take advantage of your past for a brighter future. Ash and Tanya walk through how to live on your soul line, how to release the need for perfection, and tune into yourself for the answers. This episode is packed with valuable nuggets of wisdom, you don’t want to miss it!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. 4 different angels to decision making
  2. What reflection truly means, and how to do it productively.
  3. How to disrupt a mental pattern in your life that holds you back.
  4. Creative ways to show up for your future self.

Where You Can Find Tanya Dalton

The Intentional Advantage Podcast

On Purpose by Tanya Dalton

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 208 The Benefits of Nootropics: Tips to Improve Your Brain Health with Matt Gallant
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How do you rate your attention span and ability to focus?

 

This week, Ash focuses on wellness and what supplements you put into your body. She sits down with Matt Gallant the CEO and founder of BiOptimizers to discuss all things nootropics and how to improve your brain health.

 

If you aren’t sure what nootropics are, here is your opportunity to learn. And chances are...you’re probably taking these every day and don’t even know it. 

 

When it comes to supplements it can be difficult to know which ones to prioritize, what they do to your body, and which brands to purchase from. Matt and Ash talk through all of these wellness topics and offer guidance on what you should take today to optimize your focus and mental wellness.

 

If you are feeling drained, ready to boost your focus, or are looking to better understand how your brain works and responds to different supplements...this episode has something for you!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The most common nootropics and which ones to take. 
  2. The top benefits of taking nootropics. 
  3. The different types of brain chemicals (dopamine, serotonin, adrenalin, etc.) and what happens when they are depleted or in overdrive.
  4. How to navigate safety concerns around taking supplements.

 

Resources:

The Alter Ego Effect by Todd Herman

The Powerful Engagement by Jim Loehr  

 

Where You Can Find Matt Galant  & Nootropics

nootopia.com

Want to upgrade your health? Visit organifi.com/youturn and enter code YOUTURN to get 20% off at check out!

item.title: [SOULO] EP. 207 Have Radiant Health- My Favorite Life-Changing Hacks
item.description:
Does your body trust you?

 

In this solo episode, Ash shares her own health journey and opens up more deeply about her anxiety and the messages this health concern has sent her throughout the years. Your body is sending you signals and it’s up to you to tune in and listen to what it is trying to communicate.

 

If you suffer from brain fog, constant sore throats, or allergies Ash offers a few at-home and in-office options to pursue and what these symptoms may mean. While Ash has been working through healing her Lyme disease she has gone through many tests and life shifts in order to feel well and healthy and is sharing all of her recent findings with you.

 

Here is a place to wake up and tend to your health!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to take care of your body in a way it begins to trust you.
  2. What leaky gut is and how it may be impacting your body.
  3. Ways to eat gluten-free or dairy-free that still taste yummy.
  4. What supplements and vitamins to take for optimal health.

 

Resources:

EverlyWell Food Sensitivity Tests

Apply code FRIEND15 at checkout for your 15% off.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 206 How To Overcome Failure and Thrive Adi Arezzini
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What do you do when faced with failure?

 

Get excited to learn how to set goals and face failure head-on with Ash this week as she sits down with Adi Arezzini, the SEO and founder of Teami Blends.

 

Adi shares her founding story and the pathway to discovering the benefits of her product that helped her authentically be able to sell it so well. Failure is one of the biggest fears entrepreneurship holds. Adi shares her experiences with failure and how you can overcome this fear yourself. 

 

As two businesswomen, Ash and Adi are able to offer incredible business advice on how to sustain your business, work through insecurities in business execution, and goal setting. If you are starting your own business or looking to move up in your career, there is something valuable in this episode just for YOU.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to use failure as a building block for growth.
  2. Tips to handle shifts in business.
  3. How to communicate your goals and plans with those around you.
  4. How to set goals that align with your vision.

 

Where You Can Find Adi Arezzini:

@adiarezzini

@teamiblends

https://www.teamiblends.com/

 

ORGANIFI

 

Want to upgrade your health? Visit organifi.com/youturn and enter code YOUTURN to get 20% off at check out! 

 

Here are some of Ash’s favorite goodies to put in your next coffee, tea, water or smoothie:

🥬Green Powder: Packed with spirulina, chlorella, and ashwagandha, to increase your immunity and aid your digestive tract.

 

🌟Gold powder-  A yummy anti-inflammatory superfood powder packed with reishi mushrooms, turmeric, cinnamon and magnesium to support restful relaxation and recovery.

 

--

Here are a few of Ash's personal favorites:

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 205 Ways To Get Through Hard Times With Niyc Pidgeon
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How do you manage painful moments?

 

Ash brings on her dear friend Niyc Pidgeon onto the show. Niyc is a positive psychologist, author, and business coach who developed a program for entrepreneurs to develop unstoppable success.

 

This conversation is filled with vulnerable stories and truths shared between Niyc and Ash. If you have ever struggled through loss, depression, or being in a state of numbness...this episode is here to be with you. 

 

During challenging times it can be easy to feel lost from yourself and out of control. Niyc talks through practices that will emotionally connect you to yourself, your desired future, and feel calm despite the turbulence outside. Sit down with your favorite calming beverage and a notebook and enjoy a sense of hope from this episode!

 

In this Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Tools to move back into resilience after loss and grief.
  2. The theory of suicide contagion and what it is doing in society.
  3. Prompts to opening conversations with those who are emotionally struggling.
  4. The practice of stretching happiness.

 

Where You Can Find Niyc Pidgeon

https://www.niycpidgeon.com

@niycpidgeon

Get Her Book: Now Is Your Chance By Niyc Pidgen

 

Resources:

Man’s Search For Meaning by Victor Frankl

item.title: [SOULO] Ep.204 On Hope and Decision Making
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Where are you living from a place of hope?

 

Take a ride with Ash in this solo episode to discuss the vulnerability, power, and inspiration that lives within hope. Ash shares a few personal stories that are connected to being in hope versus being in denial.

 

If you are facing a tough time, a moment of grief, or a difficult transition in life, Ash shares some insight into how to make decisions for yourself. If you are looking for a moment of inspiration mixed with realism, here is a short episode just for YOU. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn

  1. How to figure out where your hope has become delusion. 
  2. The beauty within hope.
  3. How to make decisions using your intuition and experience.

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 203 How Conflict Can Improve Your Relationship with Jayson Gaddis
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you avoid conflict?

 

This week Ash talks with Jayson Gaddis, an author, relationship expert, and coach all about the value of conflict within a relationship.

 

Conflict becomes the doorway to truthtelling. While you may be apprehensive to enter into an argument, there is an amazing opportunity to reclaim who you are, learn about the other person, and grow together, instead of apart. 

 

Part of healthy conflict is what you do after a fight. Ash and Jayson share self-soothing tools to process the conflict, release energy and come back to your partner reconnected to yourself and the relationship.

 

This episode is packed with relationships tips and treats! Tune in to learn how external factors impact your relationships, how to grow together and remain close to yourself through it all.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Indicators of whether you are in the right relationship or not.
  2. The conflict repair cycle: what it is, and how to use it.
  3. Tools to work through and process arguments and difficult topics.
  4. Self-soothing tools to feel better after conflict.
  5. The impact and importance of values within a relationship.
  6. Standing for 3: How to not leave yourself in a relationship.

 

Where To Find Jayson Gaddis 

Relationship School Podcast

gettingtozerobook.com

https://www.jaysongaddis.com/

@jayshogaddis

item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Who are you becoming?

 

This week, Ash shares from a vulnerable place about the recent life changes she has made. She talks through breakups, navigating relationship differences to understand what works for you and what doesn’t bring out the best version of you. The hardest no’s are the ones that are almost a yes.

 

Ash offers a few questions to reflect upon to help you better understand yourself and who you share with others. This episode is full of debunking relationship myths and mindset ideas, navigating love, family, work and so much more! Tune in for a conversation with one of your besties about life and the beauty it can bring.

 

In This Episode, We’ll Discuss:

  1. How to know when it’s time to leave or stay within a relationship.
  2. Why you might not be able to collaborate, and how to shift away from this habit.
  3. Spiritual bypassing and how it may show up in a relationship.
  4. Family dynamics and relationships with your parents as they age.

 

 

ValYOU

 

One of the BIGGEST things I've learned about decor is the importance of your couch-- not just for comfort, but for design... After all, it takes up MOST of the room!

 

I was in need of a decor refresh, and ran straight to Valyou Furniture for their feathers couch, which is my newest home obsession! Their products are changing the game in design, making high-end looks very affordable, which is why I reached out to them to support this episode! They deliver furniture straight to your doorstep, and the setup is SO simple. I set up my entire couch in 5 minutes!

 

Not only that, but the feathers couch is stain-resistant, machine-washable, and modular. I mean, come on.

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/valyou to get 5% off your order.



CASPER  

Are you dreaming about getting better sleep?

After being diagnosed with Lyme disease, Ashley reached out to Casper to get their Wave Hybrid mattress, known to be the PERFECT mattress that reduces body aches and increases your ZzzZZzz's! 

That being said, they have so many great options! Don't let yourself sleep every night on a mattress that doesn't fully support you- your sleep is a big deal. Head on over to Casper and check out their selection of amazing mattresses. They even have mattresses that offer a durable base for optimal support and breathable foam to keep you cool at night.

Head on over to http://casper.com

ORGANIFI

 

Want to upgrade your health? Visit organifi.com/youturn and enter code YOUTURN to get 20% off at check out! 

 

Here are some of Ash’s favorite goodies to put in your next coffee, tea, water or smoothie:

 

✨Pure Powder: Lion’s Main extract, aloe vera and ginger extract are just a few of the superfoods packed into this powder to improve your mental clarity and overall brain health.

 

🥬Green Powder: Packed with spirulina, chlorella, and ashwagandha, to increase your immunity and aid your digestive tract.

 

🌟Gold powder-  A yummy anti-inflammatory superfood powder packed with reishi mushrooms, turmeric, cinnamon and magnesium to support restful relaxation and recovery.

 

CAKE Publishing

Visit cakepublishing.com to get your next ghostwriter, copywriter, or publicist.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 201 How To Be More Resilient At Work w/Antonia Hock
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you ready for your career to reach the next level?

 

This week Ash talks with Antonia Hock, the global head of the Ritz Carlton Leadership Center and employee experience guru, all about how to build resilience at work.

 

With 89% of employees reaching a point of burnout, its important to understand the ways to curb hitting your breaking point. Antonia shares her thoughts on burnout and actionable advice on what you can do to stay engaged and excited about work. 

 

Antonia and Ash dive into the future of the workforce, how to get a mentor, ways building creativity into your work and so much more! 

 

Whether you are an entrepreneur or working as an individual contributor for a company, there is something valuable in this episode for you! You are in control of your career, and here is a place to start getting ahead. 



In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. What resilience actually is and how it shows up in your life.
  2. Steps to build grit and courage within yourself.
  3. 3 different types of mentors and tips for finding the right one.
  4. Ways to stay engaged when work becomes overwhelming
  5. How to create opportunities during moments of adversity.

 

Where You Can Find Antonia Hock:

https://www.linkedin.com/in/antonia-hock

https://ritzcarltonleadershipcenter.com/

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 200 Ways To Stay Creative During Challenging Times with Katie Dalebout
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How has this year impacted your creative juices?

 

This week Ash talks to Katie Dalebout a Podcast host, producer, and founder of Let it Out, a business and community for sharing Soft Stories. Katie is here to share the 4 step process to get more creative.

 

The truth is, creativity comes from small moments in life. Katie shares some very simple yet powerful ways to become more creative, connect more with yourself, and find joy in the world... especially during difficult times.

 

2020 was coined “the year of the breakup”. And you might be wondering, “What do breakups have to do with creativity?” well, tough times are often when creativity can be stunted and when it is needed to most. Katie and Ash talk about how to break free from creative blocks and use creativity to foster healing during challenging times.

 

Ashley reads a beautiful quote on air (you don’t want to miss this) sparking a deep conversation around love, creativity, and connection. This is a heartwarming episode filled with vulnerable truths and profound discoveries, be sure to tune in!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between soothing and solving your way through difficult times
  2. Alternative ways to journal for internal connection and growth
  3. How to create a positive creative feedback loop 
  4. The power of timing in relationships and creativity
  5. 4 steps to getting more creative

 

Resources:

Let It Out: A Journey Through Journaling by Katie Dalebout

Attached by Amir Levine

This Is Me Letting You Go by Heidi Priebe

 

Where You Can Find Katie Dalebout:

Let It Out Podcast

Spiraling Podcast

@katiedalebout

@letitouttt

Join her In Process Membership:

https://www.katiedalebout.com/in-process

Here are a few of my personal favorites:

🍊Orange Cream Gummies Try one gummy each evening to treat your little sweet tooth and experience improved sleep quality. 

 

💧CBD Oil Droppers  Enjoy the support from these oil drops to get your body back into better homeostasis. This little oil dropper is perfect to throw into your purse if you are on the go, or want to add a little extra to your cocktail or water glass.

item.title: [SOULO] Ep.199 Thoughts on Rescuing and Caretaking
item.description:
Who are you when you are not giving?

 

Tune in to this soulo episode with Ash (and her pup Jupiter) to consider where in your life you may have put others ahead of yourself and in turn, delayed your own healing, grief, or pain.

 

Here is an opportunity to reflect upon where you may be overgiving, how to notice when you are stretched too thin and what that does to your life in the long term. More life updates to come in the coming episodes with Ash, stay tuned!



ValYOU

 

One of the BIGGEST things I've learned about decor is the importance of your couch-- not just for comfort, but for design... After all, it takes up MOST of the room!

 

I was in need of a decor refresh, and ran straight to Valyou Furniture for their feathers couch, which is my newest home obsession! Their products are changing the game in design, making high-end looks very affordable, which is why I reached out to them to support this episode! They deliver furniture straight to your doorstep, and the setup is SO simple. I set up my entire couch in 5 minutes!

 

Not only that, but the feathers couch is stain-resistant, machine-washable, and modular. I mean, come on.

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/valyou to get 5% off your order.



Career Coaching Mastermind 

 

Do you want to reinvent your career by becoming a career/life coach OR you’re ready to scale your existing coaching business? 

 

Join my career coaching mastermind program!

 

This will be an intimate group of coaches working directly with myself (and a few other surprise business leaders) to remove any blocks you are holding onto, build your business acumen, increase your personal brand influence,  generate more sales, and learn tools and tactics to better serve your clients.

 

Visit ashleystahl.com/app to apply now.

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 198 How To Keep The Spark Alive In Your Marriage w/ Rachel Ballard
item.description:
Where in your relationship do you feel a sense of lack?

 

This week Ash talks with special guest Rachel Ballard all about the pillars of a great marriage. Rachel is a love coach, marriage strategist, and podcast host here to share the 3 pieces of a successful marriage.

 

First things first, in order to step into a successful relationship, you really need to have a successful relationship with yourself. Rachel offers different prompts and actions you can to truly know who you are before you get married.

 

Rachel and Ash dive into how to keep the mystery alive, cultivate respect in a relationship, build a strong friendship into your romantic partnership and so much more. You don’t want to miss this episode!

 

Whether you are facing a new relationship “normal” due to the pandemic or you are preparing yourself for your next committed relationship, this episode is packed with guidance and insight on how to cultivate a lasting relationship.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between dating and marriage.
  2. Missteps that may lead you to an unhappy relationship.
  3. What Chick porn is, and whether it is impacting your perspective on relationships.
  4. How to build respect into your relationship, and noticed if it is missing.



Where You Can Find Rachel Ballard

@howtolikeyourhusband

--

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 197 How To Use Mushrooms For Healing and Wellness with Tero Isokaupilla
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What is missing from your diet?

 

In this week’s episode, Ash brings on mushroom expert Tero Isokaupilla to share the health and healing benefits of mushrooms and other superfoods. Tero is the founder of Four Sigmatic and a 13th generation farmer who focuses on the top 100 healthiest foods in the world.

 

Tero combined his upbringing on a farm with his passion for personal development to unlock the power of mushrooms and bring them to the everyday diet. 

 

Ash and Tero talk through the various strains of mushrooms and their individual healing capacities, how to incorporate mushrooms into your daily diet, and when during the day to consume mushrooms. 

 

Psychedelic mushrooms are becoming a common topic of discussion and here is where you can learn the difference between natural and psychedelic mushrooms and how to safely consume either. 

 

Health and wellness aren’t only what foods you eat, Tero talks through how valuable understanding your dharma is with health and shares daily routine tips for overall health. This is a conversation that will transform the way you view your own wellness!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The healing benefits of different types of mushrooms.
  2. The difference between psychedelic mushrooms and herbal mushrooms.
  3. Wellness hacks to optimize your life and boost brain function.
  4. What an adaptogen is and what they do for your immunity.

 

Resources:

Healing Mushrooms by Tero Isokaupilla

Santa Sold Shrooms by Tero Isokaupilla

https://us.foursigmatic.com/

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 196 7 Pillars of Resilience with Pegah Kadkhodian
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you ready to be unshakable within yourself?

 

This week Ash talks with Pegah Kadkhodian, an executive coach, renowned speaker, and international trainer on how to create radical resilience. Here is where Pegah shares her 7 Pillars to create resilience in your life.

 

You may consider resilience to be hard, challenging, and digging deep. While this in part is true, an even deeper part of resilience lies within how you care for yourself. Pampering isn’t the only way to practice self-care. Listen in to learn key ways to care for yourself that will enable you to become more resilient in all areas of your life!

 

Pegah and Ash talk through how to remove underlying fear and anxiety, connect with your career and boost your workplace performance. There are many different resources to access to help you find clarity in your job, and Pegah shares her top assessments and tools to guide you into resilience and work you love.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to redefine resilience live it every day.
  2. Tactical and practical ways to be resilient.
  3. What self-care really looks like.
  4. Tools to manage your emotions while at work.
  5. Grounded practices to generate creativity.

 

Resources:

DISC Assessment

Wisdom of the Enneagram by Russ Hudson

The Complete Enneagram by Beatrice Chestnut

The Sacred Enneagram by Christopher Heuertz 

Strength’s Finder by Tom Rath

The Big Leap by Gay Hendricks



Where You Can Find Pegah Kadkhodian

https://coachpegah.com/

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 195 How to Maximize Your Confidence with Andrea Owen
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What do you think your superpower is?

 

This week Ash talks with Andrea Owen a certified life coach, author, and speaker all about how to choose confidence and make noise in your life.

 

If you want to step out and start something new, there will never be a “perfect moment” to begin. Andrea and Ash share their opinions on when to start and how to encourage yourself to move forward and take action with confidence.

 

If you struggle with trusting yourself and knowing when to listen to your intuition, Andrea offers valuable insight on why this may be and how to actually know what to do. This episode is packed with valuable tools and tips to uplevel your mindset with money, confidence, and taking risks.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Strategies for having a healthy relationship with money.
  2. How to start before you are ready.
  3. The role your parents play in your perspective with money and taking risks.
  4. Tools to connect with your intuition.

 

Resources:

Make Some Noise by Andrea Owen

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep.194 Why you get stuck (and how to get unstuck!) with Sarah Baldwin
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Where in your life do you feel stuck?

 

This week Ash talks to Sarah Baldwin, a somatic practitioner and trauma-informed life coach, all about how to get unstuck in your life.

 

Understanding why you feel certain ways may be just what you need to be able to move past them. Sarah shares both the emotional and psychological science that occurs when you are doing something that may feel “risky” and is holding you back. 

 

If you are ready for the next phase of your life, listen in! Sarah and Ash talk about how to break through from being stuck and take actions in the corners of life that are stagnant. A great deal of this has to do with creating safety for yourself to not fear moving forward. 

 

If you have struggled with PTSD from a form of trauma, Sarah shares insight into how to heal and move forward within this episode. Her approach is powerful, comforting, and backed by science.

 

In this Episode, You’ll Learn:

-How trauma forms and the impact that carries over into future events.

 

-How to regulate your internal systems and connect to the present moment.

 

-3 ways you respond to stress and trauma in the moment.

 

-How to feel safe connecting to yourself and others.

 

Where You Can Find Sarah Baldwin:

https://www.sarahbaldwincoaching.com/

@sarahbcoaching

https://www.instagram.com/sarahbcoaching/?hl=en

 

ORGANIFI

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 193 How to Love Yourself While Being Productive with Jessica Benstock
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you working from a place of feminine or masculine energy?

 

This week Ash steps into the love category to talk with Jessica Benstock, a therapeutic and somatic healing practitioner, trauma healer, and expert on feminie productivity. This episode is all about being productive and balanced in a feminine way.

 

It can be very easy to shift into a masculine energy, especially during the work day. Jessica offers up tools and exercises you can do to shift your energy and learn how to balance both aspects of yourself. Afterall, evolved souls know how to waver between both masculine and feminine energy.

 

Jessica and Ash talk about the value of understanding who you are versus what role you play. Jessica shares steps on how to step back into your soul and remove identities and labels that may not be serving you.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Exercises to physically open up your feminie energy while at work.
  2. How to balance feminine and masculine energy.
  3. Tools to receive and heal within your body.
  4. Steps to get back into who you are as a soul.

item.title: [SOULO] Ep. 192 Generosity, The Small Things & What They Mean
item.description:
What small things, really matter to you?

The little things add up. Whether you are in a relationship or working through what career you want to pursue, the small things in these areas of your life add up. 

Embedded in this soulo episode are questions you can ask yourself in order to see the world more clearly and how you can show up more in your life.

Ash shares her personal thoughts around how to navigate what is valuable for you and what you can let go of.

 

 

BIOPTIMIZER

 

Sick and tired of being sick or tired? 

 

If you want to improve your sleep quality, try Magnesium Breakthrough, the only magnesium supplement I know of that contains 7 different forms of magnesium.

Career Coaching Mastermind 

 

Do you want to reinvent your career by becoming a career/life coach OR you’re ready to scale your existing coaching business?

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 191 Own Your Feminine Power (Periods, Sexuality, Hormones) w/ Stephanie Estima
item.description:
Get your copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How much does your period impact your life?

 

Today Ash talks with Dr. Stephanie Estima, a Podcast Host, author, and esteemed Doctor all about how to own your feminine power.

 

Menstrual cycles can be painful, and impact every corner of your life. But there are ways you can begin to reduce PMS symptoms and understand how your cycle is working for you, not against you.

 

Dr. Stephanie shares advice beyond how to physically heal in this episode. During the month, there are certain times to make more decisions, reflect inward, and be vocal and networking. Tune in the learn when the best times to do these are for you!

 

Here is a place to better understand your menstrual cycle, connect deeper to the beauty of your feminine body, engage your libido and receive tools to feel better every single day.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What to do in the days leading up to, during, and after your menstrual cycle.
  2. How to lean into your menstrual cycle and use your hormone flow to your personal and professional advantage.
  3. Tools to improve and reduce PMS symptoms and how to reframe your perspective on PMS.
  4. How to create safe boundaries and safe places to feel all the emotions that bubble up within you.
  5. Different types of orgasms and how to nurture your sex drive.

 

Resources:

The Betty Body by Dr. Stephanie Estima

 

Where You Can Find Stephanie Estima:

Check out her podcast: Better with Dr. Stephanie Estima https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/better-with-dr-stephanie/id1479074542

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 190 Why Relationships Fail (and What To Do About It) w/Abby Medcalf
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you ready to build a healthy relationship?

 

This week, listen in as Ash talks to Abby Medcalf, an author, speaker, and relationship expert, about why relationships fail and what you can do about it. 

 

One of the main reasons people think relationships fail is due to poor communication. Well, Abby has an alternative idea that will blow your mind. Listen in to learn the #1 reason relationships don’t work out, and what you can start doing today to make sure you don’t fall into this trap.

 

Abby and Ash walk through how body image, sexuality, money, and confidence all play into the success of your relationship. If you are open to deepening your relationship or you are ready to build a foundational relationship in the future...this episode is for you!

 

In this Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Where power struggles begin and what they look like.
  2. How to create common ground with money.
  3. What to do if you are waffling back and forth in a relationship.
  4. How to set healthy boundaries for yourself.
  5. Tools to build sexual compatibility.



Where You Can Find Abby Medcalf:

https://abbymedcalf.com/

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 189 CBD 101: A Tool To Heal Anxiety, Sleep + More! w/ Angie and Mike Lee
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you curious about alternative plant medicines?

 

This week Angie Lee and her brother Mike Lee come onto the show to discuss all things CBD. Angie and Mike are a pair of powerhouse siblings that have come together to co-found Soul CBD alongside all of their other entrepreneurial and athletic ventures. 

 

The CBD market has been growing drastically in recent years and may have left you wondering whether you should take it, what its benefits are and how it may or may not be related to marijuana products. Angie and Mike walk through answers to all of these questions, along with so much more. 

 

CBD products have the capacity to support deeper sleep and reduce anxiety, but that isn’t all. Angie discusses how CBD and has helped her heal PMS symptoms and improve her menstrual cycle. Whether you are a woman looking for period relief, or a partner looking to support their loved one there are great benefits to learning more about the power of CBD.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between THC and CBD.
  2. Why you may want to take CBD and what you can expect to experience.
  3. How CBD impacts your menstrual cycle.
  4. How to navigate self dosage.

 

Where You Can Find Angie and Mike Lee:

@mysoulcbd 

https://www.instagram.com/mysoulcbd/?hl=en

Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Are you curious about alternative plant medicines?

 

This week Angie Lee and her brother Mike Lee come onto the show to discuss all things CBD. Angie and Mike are a pair of powerhouse siblings that have come together to co-found Soul CBD alongside all of their other entrepreneurial and athletic ventures. 

 

The CBD market has been growing drastically in recent years and may have left you wondering whether you should take it, what its benefits are and how it may or may not be related to marijuana products. Angie and Mike walk through answers to all of these questions, along with so much more. 

 

CBD products have the capacity to support deeper sleep and reduce anxiety, but that isn’t all. Angie discusses how CBD and has helped her heal PMS symptoms and improve her menstrual cycle. Whether you are a woman looking for period relief, or a partner looking to support their loved one there are great benefits to learning more about the power of CBD.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The difference between THC and CBD.
  2. Why you may want to take CBD and what you can expect to experience.
  3. How CBD impacts your menstrual cycle.
  4. How to navigate self dosage.

item.title: [WORK] Ep.188 Tips to Create Work-Life Balance w/ Kelsey Murphy
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you spend more time at work than you would like?

 

This week Ash talks to Kelsey Murphy a business and life coach and the founder of Whisky and Work Community to discuss work-life balance.    

 

The average employee works five extra hours of work a week. This added time adds up and can cause strain on your work-life imbalance. It may feel like life is a “this or that” mentality even though you want it all. Kelsey shares how to prioritize your life, no longer feel stuck, and what actions you can take to feel in flow with your career.

 

If you struggle to take action, this episode is for you! Kelsey and Ash walk through very specific actions you can take today to create momentum, build a mindset of action and understand where to shift your focus in order to thrive. It IS possible to create balance in your life, and here is where you can start.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What the ideal work-life balance can look like for you.
  2. How to find quality time with your kids while you work.
  3. How to find passion in your life and create a career path you love.
  4. The value of following your curiosity.

 

Where You Can Find Kelsey Murphy:

https://www.kelseymurphy.com/

item.title: [LOVE] How Your Enneagram Type Impacts Your Romantic Life w/ Kacia Fitzgerald
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How different are you from your loved ones?

 

This week Ash talks to Kacia Fitzgerald, the host of the EmpowerHer podcast, speaker, and entrepreneur to discuss comparisonitis, personality types, and how they may be impacting your personal relationships.

 

You may have heard the saying that opposites attract. At times this difference can be very hard to navigate and find common ground within. Ash and Kacia use examples from their romantic relationships to show how personality differences can actually be strengths. 

 

If you are a #bossbabe listener or in a relationship where gender roles are different from the norm, Kacia walks through how to have conversations with your partner to work through this, and practices to become more open to alternative relationship standards.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How personality differences in a relationship can be used for success.
  2. The different Enneagram personality types strengths and shadows.
  3. Tools to help keep your relationship stable when gender roles are shifted.
  4. What each Enneagram personality type needs and wants within a loving relationship.
  5. How to create more flow and soften in a relationship.
  6. A mindset to enjoy your relationship and not compare yourself to others.

 

Resources:

Enneagram Test

https://www.enneagraminstitute.com/

item.title: Ep. 186 [MINDSET] How to Be Resilient and Make a Come Back w/ Sarah Wells
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you believe in yourself?

 

This week Ash brings onto the show Sarah Wells, an Amazing Race Finalist, Olympian, Speaker, and Founder of The Belief Initiative. Sarah shares the 3 steps to making a comeback and being resilient in your life. 

 

When you hit a rock bottom or face a daunting new struggle, finding a way to never give up can feel impossible. Sarah walks through the power of your internal thoughts and an exercise you can do to build control back into your life.

 

Action is everything, and it is also one of the hardest steps to regaining your life. Saran and Ash talk through ways you can build momentum and begin taking action every day. It all starts with figuring out your “hurdle one”

 

In This Episode, We Discuss:

  1. 3 Steps to make a comeback in your life.
  2. How to leverage motivation to reach your goals.
  3. How to take back control of your life.
  4. Tips to use visualization to turn dreams into reality.

@sarahwells400mh

resilence/inc.com

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 185 The Secret To Having More Energy w/Kelly LeVeque
item.description:
What health habit is holding you back from success?

 

This week Ash talks with Kelly LeVeque a clinical nutritionist, celebrity health coach, and best-selling author about how to manage blood sugar in order to elongate success and energy.

 

What you eat, and when can make a major impact on how you think and feel throughout the day. Kelly walks through very simple, yet highly effective habits you can create around your food in order to sustain your blood sugar and not hit those energy slumps that leave you exhausted.

 

It seems like there is a new magical diet, superfood elixir, or strategy for hitting optimal nutrition and health. Well, Kelly is here to break down the science behind these and offer you a long-term solution to eating well and feeling great.

 

Whether you are curious about gut health, food sensitivity, what fad diets are right for you, or simply looking to improve your overall wellness, this episode is packed with knowledge and actionable advice. Listen in as a gift to your body!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How to reduce hunger cravings and eat meals that leave you feeling fuller longer.
  2. What the fab 4 foods are, and how to eat them at every meal.
  3. Nutritional tools to reduce inflammation, elevate your energy and get proper sleep.
  4. What healthy fats are, and how to incorporate them into your diet.
  5. The truth about artificial sweeteners and alternatives to flour.

 

ALSO… Want to boost your focus with unique, inspiring music? Download the Endel app today! 

 

Endel is an app with mood music and soundscapes that are scientifically proven to help you focus, relax and sleep. 

Try Endel for FREE for 1 month: use the code 'YOUTURN' at code.endel.io. I would love to hear what sounds you enjoy most!

 

Additional Resources:

levels.link/kelly

Body Love By Kelly LeVeque

Body Love Every Day By Kelly LeVeque

 

Where You Can Find Kelly LeVeque:

https://kellyleveque.com/

Be Well Podcast

IG: @bewellbykelly

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 184 How To Have A More Harmonious Relationship w/Stefanos Sifandos
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

Do you struggle to release masculine energy at the end of the day?

 

It’s another juicy love episode where Ash talks with Stefanos Sifandos a relationship expert, who is here to share how to create a harmonious relationship by exploring feminine and masculine dynamics.

 

The more you tell your love story, the more reinforced your relationship will become. While this is a simple tip, there are many more shared within the episode about how to build a robust relationship that is filled with love and support.

 

In 42% of US households, women are becoming the primary “breadwinners”, this shift is translating into new norms amongst relationships with a different balance to navigate. Stefanos and Ash dive into how to adjust and grow through these changes. 

 

Relationships are growing and changing at all times, Stefanos shared tips on how to grow together, navigate difficult conversations and address differences in your relationship dynamic with grace. Whether you are in a relationship now, or enjoying single life, there is something valuable for you to hear!

 

In this Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to navigate between masculine and feminine energy within your relationship.
  2. How to attract masculine men, without negotiating your own power.
  3. Tips to soothe and soften yourself at the end of the day.
  4. The different ways to embody masculine giving and feminine receiving energy.

Where You Can Connect with Stefanos Sifandos:

https://stefanossifandos.com/

@stefanossifandos

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 183 From Fear to Freedom w/Ashley LeMieux
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How does your life feel?

 

Ashley LeMieux, is an entrepreneur, author, and speaker here to share how to move from fear to freedom. Be sure to stick around for the entire episode, Ash shares a sneak-peak portion of Ashley LeMieux’s soon-to-release new book!

 

Healing doesn’t mean you will go back to how things once were, you prepare for a new future. Ashley shares her vulnerable story about healing and moving forward. Her story is filled with advice on how to heal and step into a place of freedom.

 

Clarity mapping is a framework and tool that Ashley LeMieux shares that will help you move forward. Each day, start off by asking 5 simple questions that will help guide you in the right path. Listen in to hear these insightful yet simple Q’s!

 

Whether you have lost someone from illness, are currently working through a challenging circumstance, or unfortunate loss, this episode is a beautiful message on how to move from fear into love.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The process of clarity mapping.
  2. How to reframe your thoughts during difficult times.
  3. Tools to step away from fear and into a place of love.
  4. Ways to get more in touch with your feelings and intuition.

 

Where You Can Find Ashley LeMieux:

@askleyklemieux

The I Am Podcast

Get her new Book I Am Here Here

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 182 How to Build a Speaking Career w/Haley Hoffman Smith
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Do you have an inspiring message you want to share, but aren’t sure how to speak up?

 

This week Ash talks with Haley Hoffman Smith a, professional keynote speaker about how to build a career as a public speaker.

 

Whether you want to stand up on stage and share a story, or you have a dream about making some sort of career change in your life, Haley shares words of wisdom worth tuning in to. Big courageous acts start beneath the surface, and Haley shares a few actions she does every day to spark the fire within her.

 

You don’t have to go through a near-death experience or have climbed the highest mountain in order to have a message worth sharing. Haley shares the number one way to stand out as a speaker.

 

When it comes to building a career in speaking, there is a great deal of effort and action that must be taken to become successful. Haley offers amazing tips to build a resume from the ground up, get paid gigs, and become confident on the stage. Now is your time to showcase your brilliant ideas!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How to create your own message and your own voice.
  2. Tools to improve your public speaking capability.
  3. Ways to break through as a speaker. 
  4. What a great salary looks like in speaking and how to accurately price yourself.
  5. Going above and beyond in sharing your message.

 

Resources:

Mic Drop Workshop

Her Big Idea by Haley Hoffman Smith

 

Where You Can Find Haley Hoffman Smith:

https://haleyhoffmansmith.com/

TikTok: @haleyhoffmansmith

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 181 How To Be Debt Free w/Paula Pant
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

How do you feel about spending versus saving money?

 

This is a very different week! Ash switches topics up and brings on Paula Pant, the host of the Afford Anything Podcast to talk all about how to be debt-free and financially free.

 

The topic of money can feel really uncomfortable to talk about, but Paula’s mantra you can afford anything, but not everything sparks a beautiful conversation around how to enjoy your relationship with money.

 

Have you taken the time to compare what you make, versus what you save? This gap is where the juicy opportunities for financial freedom lie. Paula and Ash talk through the various ways you can begin to grow the gap between these values and how to create consistency in your finances. And if you are an entrepreneur or small business owner unsure of how to pay yourself, here lies a path to create a stable and supportive income for yourself. 

 

Budgeting can feel restrictive and negative. But it doesn’t have to be this way! In this episode, Paula talks through her anti-budget strategy, how to enjoy saving and spend and even plan for retirement. Paula’s view on finances is unique and doesn’t make you feel as though you must restrict your money and your life.



In This Episode, We Discuss:

  1. 3 largest expenses we have, and how to make them more affordable.
  2. Grow the gap: what this means, and how to implement this idea into your financial health.
  3. Indicators of where your financial struggles lie.
  4. Budgeting advice that you can actually implement and enjoy following.
  5. How to talk with your partner about finances.

 

Where You Can Find Paula Pant:

Afford Anything Podcast

 

Resources:

Escape by Paula Pant

Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert Kiyosaki

Secrets of a Millionaire Mind by Harv Eker

Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill

Mom and Dad, We Need to Talk by Cameron Huddleston

Millionaire Teacher by Andrew Hallam

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep 180 Life Lessons From Celebrities + Working In The Public Eye w/Kelly Henderson
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

What do you really want?

 

This week, Ash brings on Kelly Henderson, a hair and makeup artist, blogger, Podcast host, and founder of the fashion and lifestyle brand VelvetsEdge to share what it really means to work in the world of celebrity.

 

Working in and with the public eye is filled with illusions. Kelly has a depth of insight and knowledge about the film, model, and entertainment industry. Whether you are avid with keeping up with celebrities or you are interested in breaking into the industry, Kelly has something informative for you.

 

Social media has become a standard within life. As Kelly grew her brand and business she shares how she managed her personal and professional life online. When it comes to online bullying and being #canceled online, Kelly shares a positive perspective and shares a few tips on how to navigate your life online with grace and compassion. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The value of likability and marketing within entertainment, or any industry and career path.
  2. Questions to ask yourself, and actions to take in order to become closer to the true version of you.
  3. How to navigate social media with grace and dignity, even when bullying or rumors arise.
  4. Tips on being patient in order to grow an authentic audience, and sustainable wealth and success.
  5. The truth about overnight success and how to maintain success once you “make it”.

 

Where You Can Find Kelly Henderson:

Instagram: @velvetsedge

Velvet's Edge Podcast

item.title: [SOULO] Ep. 179 On Healing Depression, Anxiety & Self Love w/Ashley Stahl
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley’s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

 

On a scale of 1 to 10, how do you rate your mental health today?

 

Here is a soulo episode filled with Ashley’s thoughts and experiences around depression and anxiety. 

 

While therapy, mindset work, and meditation can do wonders to impact your mental health and overall wellness, sometimes you simply need more. And that is ok! You are NOT alone. Today, one out of ten American adults is currently struggling with mental health. 

 

Whether you are struggling with postpartum depression, suicidal ideations, or are struggling to see the positive in your life, Ashley’s soulo audio has something for you. Packed into the episode, Ash shares a few exercises to help you understand how anxiety shows up in your life and the ways she has learned to navigate anxiety. 

 

Ash opens up about her past traumas, life experiences, and where she is living today with her anxiety. Sometimes hearing someone’s story can be just what you need to connect with your own. Here is a space to connect more with yourself.

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. The sneaky ways anxiety can present itself in your life.
  2. How trauma can present itself within your life.
  3. The process of choosing to use medication for anxiety or depression.
  4. Debunking the stigma’s around mental health, medication and sharing with others. 
  5. A mindset to share in your relationship with medication.

 

Resources:

Medical Medium by Anthony William

 

Promotion:

Visit YouTurnBook.com to get a copy of Ashley’s NEW book— You Turn: Get Unstuck, Discover Your Direction & Design Your Dream Career! 

 

Promotion:

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 178 How To Bolster Your Career w/ Mark Tritton
item.description:
Where in your career are you ready for a change?

 

This week, Ash dives into the work category, having a conversation with Mark Tritton, the President and Chief Executive Officer of Bed Bath & Beyond. Mark is here to talk all about how to bolster your career.

 

Blending personal growth tactics with strong business acumen, Mark shares a wealth of knowledge on how to build your career from the ground up. When it comes to creating powerful results, there are two key attributes Mark has identified that will take you far in your career...listen in the learn what they are, and how you can build them within yourself!

 

Mark shares his simple mantra for working and how you can implement it into your career today to see massive change. Whether you are in the corporate world, walking the entrepreneurial path, or looking to begin your career after college, Mark has words of wisdom for you.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How to create sharing and learning environments for your customers.
  2. The attributes that will build a leader, especially during uncertain times.
  3. Tips for balancing a healthy life with busy work life.
  4. How to be courageous in life.

 

Where You Can Find Mark Tritton:

Connect on LinkedIn: Mark Tritton

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 175 How To Have Better Relationships w/ Allana Pratt
item.description:
Have you found “the one” yet?

 

In this juicy episode in love, Ash talks to Allana Pratt, an intimacy expert, speaker, and author who is here to share the 3 key steps to having better relationships.

 

Relationships don’t come with a rule book. It can be hard to know when to stay, when to fight and how to navigate staying connected to yourself within a relationship. Allana shares her personal story and insight into how to have healthy relationships unique to you.

 

So much of a healthy romantic relationship comes down to first being connected with yourself. Ash and Allana talk through how to understand your own wants and needs in a relationship, tools for tapping into your desires, and an exercise to help you connect to your sexuality.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. 3 key steps to having better relationships.
  2. How to navigate life in a relationship after the honeymoon phase.
  3. The 3 stages of a relationship.
  4. How to identify what is non-negotiable. 
  5. What spiritual bypassing is and examples of what it looks like.

 

Resources:

Finding ‘The One' Is Bullsh*t BECOMING ‘The One’ is Brilliant & Beautiful by Allana Pratt

 

Where You Can Find Allana Pratt:

https://allanapratt.com/

Intimacy Blindspot Assessment

 

Promotion:

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 174 How To Take Care of Your Brain Health w/Dr. Kristine Willeumier
item.description:
Do you want to hack your brain to live an optimal life?

 

This week Ash talks with Dr. Kristine Willeumier, a neuroscientist with research expertise in neurobiology and neuroimaging. She is also the author of the book BioHack Your Brain and is here to share all about how to start taking care of your brain health.

 

Supplements are filling the stores and it can be really difficult to understand which ones actually help you heal and stay healthy. Dr. Kristine walks through specific supplements to take for a broad variety of common illnesses, including COVID-19. She even shares a few brands with the cleanest ingredients to invest in. 

 

Dr. Kristine and Ash talk through types of exercise to practice and what foods help improve brain health. Whether you are suffering from anxiety, depression, or overall stress with the current state of affairs, this episode is packed with medical advice on how to improve your life. Listen in for your long-term health and wellness, you won’t regret it!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to understand what supplements to use.
  2. Nutrients and supplements to take to improve immunity.
  3. How to get rid of cold sores and heal other immunocompromised illnesses.
  4. The MUST’s when it comes to overall health and wellness.
  5. Sleep aids to help you get the maximum benefits from the night.
  6. Hypnotherapy- what it is and how it helps.

 

Resources:

BioHack Your Brain by Dr. Kristine Willeumier

 

Where You Can Find Dr. Kristine Willeumier:

https://www.drwilleumier.com/

@kwiieumier 

Twitter: @drwilleumier

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 174 The Magic of Surrender w/Kute Blackson
item.description:
Where in your life could you let go of something?

 

This week, Ash brings on Kute Blackson, a transformational teacher, coach, and best-selling author to dive into the magic of surrendering in life. 

 

When you allow life to lead you, beautiful things begin to occur. So how do you get there? Kute walks through the stages of surrendering and helps you understand what stage you likely are living in right now. 

 

Grief happens all around us, whether it is the loss of a loved one, a relationship, or even an identity you once held. In this episode, Kute outlines the value of allowing yourself to feel grief, and actions you can take to move through grief with intention.  

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Actionable tips on how to let go of needing to be in control.
  2. The stages of surrender.
  3. What happens when you are living in a place of surrender.
  4. The value of experiencing grief, and how to move from heartbreak to having an open heart.

 

Resources:

The Magic of Surrender by Kute Blackson

 

Where You Can Find Kute Blackson:

https://kuteblackson.com/blog/

Themagicofsurrender.com

item.title: [SOULO] Ep. 173 On Integrity, Generosity & Loving Yourself w/Ashley Stahl
item.description:
Where are you out of alignment with yourself?

 

Join Ash for a solo jam all about trusting yourself. This conversation sparks from a journal prompt question that will help you learn where you stand in regards to your values and principles.

 

The conversation doesn’t end here, Ash shares her thoughts on generosity and how we all share it from various methods and channels. It’s all about recognizing what ways you share, and what way those around you experience generosity. Why does this all matter? If you are looking for ways to love yourself more, it comes back to how you love others.

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 172 How to Embody a Healthy Sex Life w/ Eva Clay
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com

 

What makes your erotic mind turn on?

 

Tune in to this steamy episode for a conversation all about having a healthy libido.  Ash talks with clinical sexologist and psychologist Eva Clay to dive deep into sexuality and passion in relationships.

 

Whether you are single and not interested in dating or you are struggling to keep the sexual desire alive in your relationship, Eva shares actionable tips to build your libido. There is one major impact on libido, be sure to listen in to learn how to better manage this in your life. Know that low libido isn’t wrong, it is simply telling you something. 

 

Eva walks through how to turn your sex life from an athletic event into a creative and passionate experience, ways to naturally boost your estrogen levels, and how to connect to your eroticism. Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash where she gets personal and shares her added insight into sexuality.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. Connection between sex and success in all aspects of life.
  2. Causes of libido shift and how to build a stronger desire for passion in your life.
  3. How to keep a long-term sexual connection in your relationship.
  4. Ways to shift the conversation of sex from faux pas to curious and comfortable.
  5. How to ask for what you want from an empowered place.

 

Where To Find Eva Clay:

evaclay.com

Instagram: @evaclay

Whether you are single and not interested in dating or you are struggling to keep the sexual desire alive in your relationship, Eva shares actionable tips to build your libido. There is one major impact on libido, be sure to listen in to learn how to better manage this in your life. Know that low libido isn’t wrong, it is simply telling you something. 

 

Eva walks through how to turn your sex life from an athletic event into a creative and passionate experience, ways to naturally boost your estrogen levels, and how to connect to your eroticism. Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash where she gets personal and shares her added insight into sexuality.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. Connection between sex and success in all aspects of life.
  2. Causes of libido shift and how to build a stronger desire for passion in your life.
  3. How to keep a long-term sexual connection in your relationship.
  4. Ways to shift the conversation of sex from faux pas to curious and comfortable.
  5. How to ask for what you want from an empowered place.

 

Where To Find Eva Clay:

evaclay.com

Instagram: @evaclay

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 171 How to Build Real Relationships at Work w/Mark Shapiro
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Are you lost when it comes to building professional relationships you actually enjoy?

 

This week Ash talks with Mark Shapiro, the CEO of Digital Humanity Inc, the visionary behind the LoveBomb app and the Podcast host of the show Are You Being Real? Mark is a wealth of knowledge within the business world, and he shares nuggets of gold on how to build real relationships in your career. Listen in to hear the ONE thing that is holding you back from being authentic at work.

 

We spend the majority of our lives at work, so shouldn’t our relationships with coworkers, business partners, and clients be real, genuine, and enjoyable?  Mark opens up how he has found ways to be himself at work and offers actionable tips to apply within your relationships.

 

Mark and Ash talk through how to express yourself authentically to generate connection, how to approach relationships within the workplace with grace, and ways to remove blockers that may be holding you back from connecting with others more closely.  

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. The value of authenticity within relationships at work.
  2. The ONE thing that holds you back from being real, and how to overcome it.
  3. Tips on how to remove blocks that hold you back in work and in relationships.
  4. 3 types of friendship that exist.

Instagram: @areyoubeingreal and @lovebomb.app

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep 170 How To Up Your Immunity w/Dr. Stephen Cabral
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ashley's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com

Are you looking for ways to boost your health during these difficult times?

 

This week Ash brings on a world-renowned doctor to share vital insight into how to boost your immunity and improve your overall health. Dr. Stephen Cabral is not only a doctor but also an author and podcast host. 

 

This episode is packed with insights, resources and explanations on how to improve your overall health and wellness. Whether you are looking to manage inflammation, improve gut health or find ways to rebalance and optimize your immune system, Cabral has insights for you!

 

The pandemic has shown the deep value of health, and most importantly, how immune we are to fighting off unwanted diseases and illnesses. Cabral and Ash talk through simple solutions you can implement in your life today to set yourself up for a life of health. After all, if you feel good in your body and mind, you will feel better in life. 

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. What 3 products to remove from your home to reduce toxicity.
  2. The Big 5 tests for overall health.
  3. The top supplements to take for optimal health.
  4. How to improve your immunity through a holistic health approach.
  5. What hand sanitizers to use and actions you can take to help reduce your chances of getting COVID or other illness.

 

Resources:

The Rain Barrell Effect by Stephen Cabral

Health products: https://stephencabral.com/resources/

https://equi.life/

 

Where You Can Find Stephen Cabral:

https://stephencabral.com/

The Cabral Concept Podcast

 

Promotion:

You can with the amazing tool, JobSeer. With the JobSeer Chrome Extension, you can scan your resume, uncover recruiters’ contact info and find job listings that are right for you!

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 169 Understanding Your Human Design w/Erin Claire Jones
item.description:
Do you wonder where your innate strengths come from?

 

This week, Ash talks with Erin Claire Jones, a leadership coach and specialist in all things human design. 

 

Erin walks through the 5 types of human design and shares both the strengths and shadows that lie within each. If you love identifying your personality type or simply want to explore your personal development deeper, listen in!

 

The power of understanding your human design lives within learning how you can use your innate presence to step into greatness, each design does so in different ways.

 

This episode is filled with insight on how to navigate communication, improve relationships, and pursue your career goals in a way that is most aligned with your natural state of being. 

 

In this episode, you’ll learn:

  1. The 5 types within the human design.
  2. How your design is identified and what it means about your personality.
  3. How to make decisions based on your human design.
  4. Tools to better connect and communicate with those around you based on their human design.

 

Where You can find Erin Claire Jones:

erinclairejones.com
 
Instagram: instagram.com/erinclairejones
 
Get your Blueprint, a personalized guide to your unique design: erinclairejones.com/blueprint
 
Use code ASHLEY to get 10% off your Blueprint.
 
Look up your design: erinclairejones.com/lookup
 
Book an individual or partnership session with Erin here: erinclairejones.com/individual

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 168 How to Communicate with Your Partner w/ Rebecca Boatman
item.description:
Get your own copy of Ash's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Do you find yourself getting upset or frustrated when communicating with a loved one?

 

Hop into the love category with Ash where she talks with Rebecca Boatman, a dating and relationship expert and coach. Rebecca is here to talk all about how to have a curious conversation with your partner, specifically using the three steps of the imago dialogue technique.

 

With dating shifting virtual, Rebecca shares examples of text messages you can use to flirt and connect when you aren’t physically together. And, on the flip side, if you are in close quarters with your loved one, listen in to hear creative ways to spend time alone, and also new opportunities for you to grow your relationship together.

 

The two talk through how to recognize and shift patterns within your relationships, when to stay versus go and Rebecca walks through a tool and actionable exercise to use when emotions are running high yet you want to communicate clearly. Whether you are in a committed relationship or enjoying the single life, learning how to communicate clearly is a skill set we all can benefit from You don’t want to miss this episode!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. The three steps of the imago dialogue.
  2. How to navigate when you are nagging someone, or feel nagged.
  3. The powerful exercise of soul gazing.

 

Where You Can Find Rebecca Boatman

@rebeccaboatman

Join Rebecca's Manifest Your Evolved Man Course

Rebecca's self-study, results-proven course is designed for the good-hearted single woman who wants to attract a loving & committed partnership with a man of integrity & honor... This course is NOT for the woman who is interested in casual flings. It is a step-by-step process that covers the energetic + practical steps to falling in love with your dream man!

item.title: [SOULO] On Commitment, Social Pressure + Rushing
item.description:
Get Your copy of Ashley's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Are you racing your romance to meet a deadline?

 

Ash shares her thoughts on the pressure of the biological time clock, invisible timelines from society, and relationship norms. The definition of marriage looks very different to many people, but do you know what it means to you?

 

Whether you are single or on the verge of marriage, Ash shares thought proving questions and a powerful perspective on relationships. For many women, the need to have children can put some powerful pressure on all aspects of life. If you are stressing about getting married or feeling pressured to having children, listen in for a dose of support.

item.title: [WELLNESS] Ep. 166 How To Create Physical and Emotional Intelligence w/Josh Trent
item.description:
Get your very own copy of Ashley's new book You Turn at youturnbook.com

 

Have you ever thought to yourself, “I am so done” but then don’t take action?

 

This week, Ash brings on Josh Trent the Founder of Wellness Force and Podcast host who leverages over 20 years of experience to help others optimize their potential to living well and find freedom from chronic stress.

 

The wellness industry can be overwhelming, but Josh has identified a single component within your body where all health and wellness starts. Listen in to learn what this is, and how you can change your life to better optimize your health. Ash and Josh get honest about how to practice true self-love, navigate the emotional stacking judgment loop, and work through suicidal thoughts and depression.

 

Breathwork is becoming a more mainstream tool, and for great reasons. Josh shares what actually happens to your body when you focus on your breath and walk through a few specific breath patterns to regulate and control stress.  Even more specifically, for all the ladies who struggle with menstrual pains, Josh shares a breath pattern you can use to get through those difficult days. Join Ash on this journey into Wellness!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. The 4 Quadrants of well-being.
  2. How to use breathwork to step into peace during stress.
  3. The difference between wellness and fitness.
  4. A tool to connect your head to your heart in order to make strong decisions and live more joyfully. 
  5. The impact of inflammation on health and how you can make changes to improve yours.

 

Where You Can Find Josh Trent:

https://wellnessforce.com/

Instagram: @trent_sd

 

Promotion:
