item.title: Ep. 78: Thoughts on Money + Buying Decisions (From Ash Stahl)
[WORK] Ep. 77: How To Become A World Class Writer w/ Nicolas Cole
item.description:
Do you dream of becoming a successful writer and perhaps struggle with where to start?

This week Ash talks with Nicolas Cole, the founder of Digital Press and the most read writer on the famous platform Quora, about how to become a better writer.  Whether you write professionally, as a hobby, or send emails every day, there is something in this episode specifically for you.  Nicolas walks through 3 main steps for how to become a better writer, and they are not what you might think.

Nicolas shares the compelling and alternative path that led him to become the masterful writer and successful entrepreneur that he is today.  Listen in to hear the 1 main thing you must do in order to become successful in writing and in life.

We are all born creative, and it can be difficult to navigate personal creativity and creating content that sells.  Nicolas and Ash talk through the difference between writing as a science and writing as an art form and how to blend the two together to find passion in all areas of writing. 

When it comes to breaking through the big bad viral world, Nicolas has honed in on how to do this over and over.  His insights will show you not only how to become a better writer but how to get your writing shared with the world on a mass scale, and stay true to your voice in the process.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash as she breaks down in-depth one of the steps to success.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. Three steps to writing success.
  2. How to keep your passion alive while building a business and craft.
  3. The value behind taking an alternative path.
  4. One key way to determine where your area of expertise lies.

 

Where To Find Nicolas Cole:

www.digitalpress.com

www.nicolascole.com

Nicolas Cole on Quora and Medium

 

Promotion:

Looking to start a new business?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/biz

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 76: How To Change Your Life (And Set Yourself Free) w/ Tatyana Rae
item.description:
What does freedom look like to you?

This week Ash sits down with Tatyana Rae to talk about how to change your life and set yourself free.  This episode is jam-packed with incredible insight into living an empowered and free life.

Tatyana was raised with what is today considered a “holistic” lifestyle.  She has grown in this path and now come to share with others how to understand yourself more fully and make healthy life choices.  Shame, blame, and ignoring your intuition are a huge part of human life, but it doesn't have to be that way!  Listen in to learn how to shift your life in a different direction.

Our bodies play a large role in driving who we are and what we experience.  Tatyana shares a fascinating way to view your body that will completely change how you feel about yourself.  It doesn’t stop here, she shares some powerful insight into the impact of taking care of yourself and removing toxic habits.

If you are tired of feeling like a victim in your life, Tatyana and Ash walk through the reasons many people feel this way and how to shed the old stories and lies that have created the life you currently live.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. How to use your intuition to guide your relationships.
  2. What nest energy is and how it impacts your life.
  3. How to differentiation instinct versus fear.
  4. What happens when you remove shame and blame from your life.

 

Where To Find Tatyana Rae:

(714)-615-1813

nkdblss@aol.com

www.tatyanarae.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/clarity

item.title: [LOVE] Ep 75. How to Find True Love w/ Christine Hassler
item.description:
Have you ever heard or realized you keep dating someone just like your mom or dad?

This week Ash sits down with Christine Hassler to discuss overcoming blocks and how to find true love.  Christine is a master coach who blends spiritual psychology and intuition into her work as a best-selling author, keynote speaker and host of the show Over It and On With It.

We all experience concerns about safety in our daily life and relationships.  Christine walks through one actionable step you can do take any moment to help you feel safe and some key indicators that a person or situation is not safe.  Narcissists are major drivers for instability,  Christine and Ash share key signs that you might be dating a narcissist and how to recover.

Many people end up dating someone just like their parents.  Learn why you do this, what your core wounds are and ways to make changes to build better relationships.  Christine walks through three main core wounds you may experience and specific methods to move through them.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash!

 

In This Episode, You’ll Learn:

  1. Different ways that control shows up in your life and why they are there.
  2. How relationships with your parents impact your love life.
  3. Tools to create self-acceptance.
  4. What level of spark you want to feel with a partner.

 

Where To Find Christine Hassler:

christinehassler.com/mastery

Instagram: @christinehassler

Podcast: Over It and On With It

 

Promotion:

Want to land the job you love? Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 74: Steps To Becoming a Professional Speaker w/ Sarah Pendrick
item.description:
Have you dreamed of hosting a live event to share a powerful message with people you care about?

 

Join Ash this week in talking with Sarah Pendrick, a host on entrepreneur.com, international Speaker, and recent award winner from the UN for Empowering Women.  She is the founder of GirlTalk Network, an organization grounded in leading women to support one another.  Listen in to learn how to become a professional speaker and grow a platform to share your unique message.

 

A great deal of what holds people back from taking large leaps is the fear of saying no.  Sarah invites you to question what the word no means to you and why you have a hard time saying it.  Putting on an event can be a scary feeling, Sarah walks through the entire process and is walking proof that you don’t need thousands of followers to sell out your event. 

 

Sarah shares her story and the role that other women have played in her journey to connect and empower women all over the world.  A great deal of her success is attributed to making major mindset shifts and managing the stories she once told herself.  Learn how she made these changes and how you can do the same.  Don’t forget to stick around for post-episode notes with Ash, she shares a powerful question to ask yourself that will guide you to connect with your true self.

 

In This Episode You Will Learn:

  1. How to step out of your fear and share your message.
  2. Ways to authentically connect with others through social media.
  3. Steps to take to set up your live event.
  4. The power behind sponsors and how to get them involved in your cause.

 

Where You Can Find Sarah Pendrick:

Instagram: @sarahpendrick

www.girltaknetwork.org

 

Promotion:

Want to land your dream job?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 73: How To Take More Inspired Action w/ Nathaniel Solace
item.description:
How often do you find yourself wanting to make change in your life?

Join Ash this week while she meets with Nathaniel Solace, a leadership and consciousness coach.  He is the founder of Gamapreneur a program based on helping you fully embody who you are and what you are doing in the world.

Have you created a repetitive routine and live each day in the same pattern?  There is a great deal of power behind breaking free from this!  Ash and Nathaniel break down pattern interrupts and how valuable they can be to provide a different perspective and spark creativity in your life.

We each have a belief system and a story that we live by.  In order to break free from these limitations, Nathaniel shares actionable tips and ideas to consider for reframing your life and how to step into the person you want to become.  One of the biggest ways to do this is through facing trauma.  Trauma can be defined as an incomplete experience and Nathalie shares a few simple yet effective ways to help you make change and find closure.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode show notes with Ash!  She dives into the depth and growth within trauma.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How lucid dreaming happens and ways to get into it.
  2. What a pattern interrupt is and how to use them to your advantage.
  3. What a context audit is and how to do one on yourself.

 

Resources:

You Are The Placebo by Dr. Joe Dispenza

Willpower Doesn't Work by Benjamin Hardy

 

Where To Find Nathaniel Solace

Instagram: @nathaniel_solace

www.nathanielsolace.com

Twitter: @hackyourhuman

 

Promotion:

Want to land the job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 72: How to Keep the Spark Alive in your Relationship w/ Vanessa Marin
item.description:
Does your sex life leave you feeling unsatisfied?

Join Ash this week while she interviews Vanessa Marin a licensed sex therapist who helps individuals and couples learn to value their own pleasure.  Listen in to learn how to keep the spark alive in your relationships.

Sex is challenging for everyone, especially when you are used to living in your masculine energy.  If you struggle with reaching orgasm, Vanessa shares tips on how to remove the shame you feel centered in this and tips to reach that big-o.  

Chemistry is something that we create and is something that must be nourished over time.  Learn what side of the spectrum your relationship lies on and where you can make changes to get it where you want. 

Vanessa shares one key characteristic in a partner to look for in order to have a healthy sex life with your partner.  Never underestimate the power of sex, masturbation, and organism.  There are a handful of benefits and Vanessa and Ash break them all down.  Don't forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes, juicy as ever!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. How to balance masculine and feminine energy in and out of the bedroom.
  2. How to remove the shame from not orgasming or having performance anxiety.
  3. Blockages holding you back from keeping the spark alive in your sex life.
  4. Steps to get in touch with your sex life.

 

Where You Can Find Vanessa:

www.vmtherapy.com

vmtherapy.com/best-way-to-orgasm.com

Instagram: @vanessamarin

 

Promotions:

Ready to land the job you love? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 71: How to Identify + Release Addiction w/ Anna David
item.description:
Has the fear of your addiction started to weight into your everyday life, or are you questioning if you have a problem with addiction?

Join Ash this week to hear from Anna David, an eight time best selling author, journalist and podcast host who specializes in helping people tell their darkest stories to find spiritual light and humor.  Listen in to learn how to identify and release addiction within your life.

If you find yourself living in a spiral of shame around an addiction, learn what to do to get out of it and what ways you can seek help.  Addiction is more than drugs and drinking, Ash and Anna discuss dependencies of many kinds and how you can tell if it is inhibiting your life.  Some compulsive habits might seem socially acceptable (exercise, committed work ethic) listen in to learn the signs you may be taking it too far. 

Anna’s successful life was previously lived within addiction that ultimately lead to rehab and building a new life.   She shares her journey and inspiring story to overcome life obstacles and build healthy relationships.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash, she will share how your body responds to addiction.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. Causes of addiction- genetic or disease.
  2. The power behind the stories we tell ourselves about addiction.
  3. The difference between pleasure and happiness.
  4. Signs you should seek help for your dependencies.

 

Resources:

Party Girl by Anna David

 

Where To Find Anna David:

www.freebookcall.com

www.futureauthorquiz.com

www.lighthustlepublishing.com

Instagram: @annadavid

 

Promotion:

Want to launch your dream business?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/biz

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 70: How to Embrace your Authentic Self w/ Gavin Frye
item.description:
Are you tired of holding back your truth and feel prepared to live authentically?

 

This week Ash talks with Gavin Frye a marriage and family therapist who also created a powerful curriculum of learning at UC Santa Monica.  Plug into this conversation to learn the tools to embrace your authentic self.  

 

When something small disrupts your peace, it may be steaming from a deeper truth that is being triggered.  Learn how to recognize these triggers and how to honor and work through them. In today’s polite society there are many times when you may hold back your truth, Gavin and Ash talk through ways in which you can be authentic and remain respectful with others.

 

Some of the closest relationships in life are the most frightening to be fully authentic within.  Learn a single tool for people within an intimate relationship to practice in a safe space that will help share your truth to one another.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes!

 

Resources:

Care of The Soul by Thomas Moore

Letting Go by David Hawkings

 

In This Episode You Will Learn:

  1. Tools to embrace your authentic self.
  2. How to gracefully manage relationships with authenticity.
  3. Ways to surrender into who you are.

 

Where You Can Find Gavin Frye:

www.gavinjamesfrye.com

(805)-320-1224

gavin@gavinfrye.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/clarity

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 69: The 4 Types Of Boundaries In Love w/ Silvy Khoucasian
item.description:
Have you ever felt a line was crossed in your relationship and you didn’t do anything?

Join Ash this week as she talks with Silvy Khoucasian, a relationship coach, who focuses on boundaries and attachment styles.  She shares the 4 ways your boundaries can get violated and actionable ways to repair them.

There is a major tie between attachment styles and boundaries.  Ash and Silvy break down what the attachment styles are, where they come from, and what their impact on your relationships can be.  Silvy sheds light on how and why your adult relationships patterns are a byproduct of your childhood and the parenting style you received.  Often times it might feel like you give everything in a relationship and receive nothing in return.  Silvy outlines how to break this cycle and give in relationships without neglecting your own needs.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes, Ash goes even deeper and shares her insights around core values and the vital role they play in relationships.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  • The 4 main ways boundaries are crossed.
  • What verbal cues to look for when your spiritual boundaries are being violated.
  • How your attachment styles impact your relationships and the boundaries built within them.

 

Where To Find Silvy Khoucasian:

Instagram: @silvykhoucasian

http://www.silvykhoucasian.com/

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 68: 5 Steps To Be An Excellent Speaker w/ Carmine Gallo
item.description:
Does the thought of public speaking in front of an audience make you nervous?

This week Ash is joined by Carmine Gallo, an author, keynote speaker, and executive coach, to discuss the value of communication and how to improve your speaking skills.  Learn the 5 steps to stand out with your communication, whether in a work meeting, giving a presentation or persuading someone to believe in your idea.

In this quickly evolving world where the platform to share your ideas has grown, the power of persuasion is more important than ever.  Carmine and Ash reveal a three step set up to create memorable content and compelling speeches that will guarantee you make an impact.

Even with a perfect presentation prepared, one of the biggest things to overcome with public speaking is fear.  Learn how to reframe your thoughts and the power they have in making you a step up to speak with success.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes to learn about the power of positive visualization and how it helped her prepare for TEDx!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  • What to remove immediately from all your presentation slides.
  • The power that storytelling has on communication.
  • Why you should be a learn-it-all, not a know-it-all.

 

Resources:

Five Stars by Carmine Gallo

Originals by Adam Grant

 

Where You Can Find Carmine Gallo:

www.carminegallo.com

www.thefivestarsbook.com

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep 67: How To Be More Inspired + Creative w/ Steve Chandler
item.description:
Are you holding you happiness hostage?

Join Ash this week as she talks with Steve Chander, a consultant, coach, and author who specializes in the ability to build creativity and remove the labels placed upon ourselves.  We are all born with divine creativity, and it often gets lost as we grow up.  Steve provides specific actions and mind-shifts you can make to raise your creativity.

Every day we all tell ourselves stories, learn how they impact you and what you can do to change them.  You do not want to miss this episode, as Steve and Ash break down these stories and beliefs that we tell ourselves, and how, if you want to change your life and reinvent yourself, you can!  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes as Ash shares the impact your physical wellness has on creativity and how to remove creative blocks.

 

In this episode, you will learn:

  • Where creativity comes from, and how to nurture it back into your life.
  • How to remove the victim mentality from your life.
  • The truth behind gratitude.

 

Resources:

The Prosperous Coach By Steve Chandler

 

Where to find Steve Chandler:

www.stevechandler.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/clarity

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 66: How to Create Sexual Chemistry w/ John Wineland
item.description:
Have you lost your desire for sexual intimacy with your partner?

Sit down with Ash this week as she talks with John Wineland, a speaker, teacher, and writer who specializes in sexual intimacy and relational communication.  John shares valuable steps to create sexual chemistry between you and your partner and the reasons why it may have become lost.

John walks through the value of feminine and masculine energy and how to move through each during the day.  This can be especially valuable with the women stepping into bossbabe roles, who may struggle to remove the masculine energy at the end of the workday.  If you are in a relationship where the sexual chemistry is drying out, John shares the root cause of why this is and how to work through it into clarity.  Don’t worry, if you are single or you are seeking a deeper understanding of sexual connection, there is enough juice in this episode to help you for the future.  Don’t forget to stick around for the post-episode notes, Ash talks about the value trust plays on intimacy and ways to gain it back!

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  • How to build your sexual chemistry.
  • The connection that your childhood has on attraction.
  • The value of masculine and feminine energy.
  • Insight into polyamory and what to prepare for in a polyamorous relationship.

 

Resources:

Getting the Love You Want by Harville Hendrix

 

Where to Find John Wineland:

Johnwineland.com

Instagram: @john_wineland

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/clarity

item.title: Ep. 65: Thoughts on Inspiration (From Ashley Stahl)
[WORK] Ep 64: Burnt Out? Here are The Steps To Overcome It w/ Emilie Aries
item.description:
Does the sense of hopelessness and exhaustion ever creep into your life?

Join Ash this week as she sits down with Emilie Aires, an author, Podcast host, founder and CEO of Bossed Up, to talk about one very important thing–burnout.  Emilie shares the 4 root causes of burnout, how to notice it creeping up and actionable steps to overcome it.

We live in a burnout culture where being busy and on-the-go is valued more than self-care and rest.  Emilie and Ash discuss the impact this culture has on mental health, engagement and even the financial impact it places on businesses and corporations.  Burnout can arise from lack of 4 main elements that are key to human success, Emilie shares what they are, and how to take steps in each area to improve them.  Burnout can be cured, and know, you are not alone in experiencing it.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes where she shares a vital experience and tip that helped her recover from burnout in the past.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. What burnout actually looks like.
  2. The difference between chronic and acute stress.
  3. How to determine the root cause of your burnout.

 

Resources:

Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-8255 and suicidepreventionlifeline.org

Bossed Up: A Grown Woman’s Guide to Getting Your Shit Together by Emilie Aires

 

Where to Find Emilie Aires:

Podcast: Bossed Up

www.bossedup.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to find the job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer
item.content:encoded:
Does the sense of hopelessness and exhaustion ever creep into your life?

Join Ash this week as she sits down with Emilie Aires, an author, Podcast host, founder and CEO of Bossed Up, to talk about one very important thing–burnout.  Emilie shares the 4 root causes of burnout, how to notice it creeping up and actionable steps to overcome it.

We live in a burnout culture where being busy and on-the-go is valued more than self-care and rest.  Emilie and Ash discuss the impact this culture has on mental health, engagement and even the financial impact it places on businesses and corporations.  Burnout can arise from lack of 4 main elements that are key to human success, Emilie shares what they are, and how to take steps in each area to improve them.  Burnout can be cured, and know, you are not alone in experiencing it.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes where she shares a vital experience and tip that helped her recover from burnout in the past.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

  1. What burnout actually looks like.
  2. The difference between chronic and acute stress.
  3. How to determine the root cause of your burnout.

 

Resources:

Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-8255 and suicidepreventionlifeline.org

Bossed Up: A Grown Woman’s Guide to Getting Your Shit Together by Emilie Aires

 

Where to Find Emilie Aires:

Podcast: Bossed Up

www.bossedup.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to find the job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [LOVE] Ep 63: 4 Steps to Call in Your Soulmate w/ Ginger Marie Corwin
item.description:
Do you find yourself questioning if you will ever find the right person and relationship?

Join Ash this week for a conversation about love, with Ginger Marie Corwin, a speaker, life coach and author of Your Weekly Guide to Bliss.  Ginger shares her 4 simple yet transformation steps to call in the one.

If you feel stuck in a relationship or find yourself constantly in the same type of relationship, Ginger reveals how your thought patterns and the story you tell yourself dictate where your relationships grow and go.  Listen in to learn skills for breaking this pattern and reshaping your life’s love path.  Manifestation is a powerful tool and Ginger outlines how to create the life of love that you want before you even meet your ideal partner.

As always, stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes as she dives into a single way to figure out whether you should stay or leave a relationship that doesn’t feel right.

 

In This Episode, You Will Learn:

1.  What your self-talk is saying about you.
2.  Methods to finally release the emotional hold you have on an ex.
3.  The power of the thoughts you tell yourself and how to change them.
4.  How to get clear on what you really want from your partner.

 

Resources:

Your Weekly Guide to Bliss by Ginger Marie Corwin

 

Where to Find Ginger Marie Corwin:

www.gingermariecorwin.com
Instagram: @gingermariecorwin

 

Want to find the dream job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: Ep. 62: Thoughts On How To Be Authentic (From Ashley Stahl)
[MINDSET] Ep. 61: 6 Steps to Upgrade Your Relationship with Money w/ Morgana Rae
item.description:
If money was a person, who would they be?

This week Ash talks with Morgana Rae a ten times #1 International best selling author and a top money expert and coach. Morgana shares her 6 steps to upgrade your relationship with money and how to uncover your blocks to financial abundance. She shares 2 transformational questions to ask yourself when ready to change how money is present in your life. The root cause of your money relationship often comes from a very specific event, and it isn’t what you think.

If you suffer from anxiety around the topic of money, Morgana shares the tools to help resolve and pivot this perspective and relationship.

Do you want money to be a monster, or a sweet honey, in your life? Through the story of her personal journey, and working with Ash, Morgana threads her steps together within this visual process of transforming your money monster, into a money honey. Definitely stick around for the post episodes notes with Ash this week, she gets personal about where her money relationship stems from and shares actionable advice on working through breaking down financial barriers.

In This Episode, You Will Learn How To:
1. Recognize the connection between your body and money.
2. Get closer to the root cause of where money sits for you.
3. Differentiate between your mindset and heartset with money.
4. Break free from your limiting financial relationship.

Resources:
Financial Alchemy: Twelve Months of Magic and Manifestation (Volume 1) By Morgana Rae

Where to find Morgana Rae:
www.morganarae.com

Want to land the job you love? Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 60: How To Leverage Instagram w/ Natalie Ellis
item.description:
Are you struggling with the growth of your social media accounts?

Join Ash this week as she talks with Natalie Ellis, founder of BossBabe Inc and all-around Instagram baller, about the power of social media.  Natalie outlines the key steps you need to take for creating a personal brand and how to generate meaningful content.

The road to success was not overnight for Natalie, and she sheds light on the growth and mindset shifts required to create lasting success.  Natalie shares her perspective on thought leadership, viral content and the power of building a community on and offline.  If you are in the workforce and want to leave, Natalie reveals one key action to take in paving the way, but it’s not what you might expect.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes to learn more about her thoughts on business success.

 

In this Episode, Learn:

1.  The reasons you should not strive for overnight success.
2.  How to create a personal brand on social media.
3.  The questions to ask yourself to determine your brand strategy.
4.  How to make your content go viral.

 

Resources:

Magnetic Marketing: How To Attract A Flood Of New Customers That Pay, Stay, and Refer by Dan S. Kennedy

 

Where to Find Natalie Ellis:

Podcast: BossBabe

Instagram: @bossbabe.inc and @iamnatalie

 

Want to launch your dream business?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/biz

item.title: [SMARTS] Ep. 59: Terrorism: Is It An Actual Threat In The United States? w/ Bob Dougherty
item.description:
Do you want to know one simple way to protect yourself during a moment of crisis?

Ash sits down this week to dive back into her previous career life in counterterrorism and discuss social and political issues with guest Bob Dougherty.  Bob spent 26 years in the CIA supporting special operations and working with Islamic extremism.

Ash and Bob reveal a glimpse into the secret world of the CIA and provide an engaging background on the history of the Arab Spring, gun control and what is actually a security threat today. Bob shares his views on the power of situational awareness in acquiring intel, and how this skill translates into any career.  Discover what his biggest concern for the future protection of the country is, and what we can do to protect against it.

 

In this Episode, You Will Learn:

1. What to look for and what do when you suspect something or someone, is dangerous.
2. The power social media has on terrorism and politics.
3. How America is viewed by the rest of the world.

 

Resources:

The Quantum Spy By David Ignatius

Joint Regional Intelligence Center: www.jric.org

Combating terrorism: https://ctc.usma.edu/

Intel Center: www.intelcenter.org

 

Where to Find Bob Dougherty:

robert@tartarusintel.com

 

Want to land the job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 58: How to Get Out of Debt with Ashley Feinstein Gerstley
item.description:
What do you feel when you hear the word “money”?

Sit down with Ash this week while she interviews Ashley Gerstley, a money coach and the author of The 30-Day Money Cleanse.  The two Ashley’s discuss tips on getting out of debt and how to improve your relationship with money.  Money is one taboo topic, leaving most of us in the dark with how to manage it.  Because of this, Ashley outlines her 4 key steps to take control of finances and spending patterns.  Did you know that there are three layers to debt?  Ashley breaks down what they are, and how best to recover from them.

Money can be an emotionally charging concept, Ashley invites you to let go of the shame you may feel around self-worth and build a healthy long lasting relationship with your finances.  Part of this is recognizing and releasing environmental toxins.  Listen in to learn what they are, and tips to improve them.  The post-episode notes are key to this episode, stay tuned in to learn how Ash recovered from debt and what she realized along the way!

 

In This Episode, Learn How To:

1. View money as accessible and fun.
2. Debunk the confusion with credit scores and interest rates.
3. Create and understand intentional spending.
4. Navigate relationships where money is viewed and valued differently.

 

Resources:

30 Day Money Cleanse by Ashley Gerstley

The Third Door by Alex Banayan

 

Where to Find Ashley Gerstley:

www.thefiscalfemme.com

Instagram: thefiscalfemme

 

Want to land the job you love?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 57: Sick of Dating? Here’s What To Do w/ Nicole Moore
item.description:
Have you been questioning whether to give up on dating?

Join Ash this week while she interviews Nicole Moore, about navigating the world of dating and becoming the love you seek from others.  Nicole is an acclaimed love coach, and creator of the Loveworks Method, helping influential women unlock their hearts and create lasting love.  She shares five transformational steps to work through dating and calling the love you want into your life.  

Staying positive while dating, especially in today’s world, can get really difficult.  When you begin to apply these ideas and practices into your daily life, Nicole will show you how dating takes on a whole new application and appreciation.  If you are wondering whether someone, or a relationship, in your life, is toxic, Nicole and Ash walk through ways to determine this, and how to break away.  As always, stick around for the post-episode notes with Ash.  This week she shares some powerful learnings on her personal journey through love!

 

In This Episode, Learn How To:

  1. Take a mindset shift on dating.
  2. Identify and eliminate toxic people and relationships.
  3. Use dating as a tool for personal growth.
  4. Manifest the love you want into life.

 

Resources:

A Course In Miracles By Helen Schucman

The Mastery of Love By Don Miguel Ruiz

 

Where to Find Nicole Moore:

www.loveworksmethod.com

Instagram: @nicolemoore

Podcast: Love Works with Nicole Moore

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you? Visit youturnpodcast.com/clarity

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 56: How To Turn Facebook Groups Into Clients w/ Libby Crow
item.description:
This week is a treat!  Ash sits down with Libby Crow, an entrepreneur, blogger, and all-around content conversion fairy, to learn how to create leads and close sales.  Libby reveals her top two favorite ways to get leads and the one place where 75% of her sales come from.  

The juice of this podcast lies in Libby sharing her golden ticket process to make a call to action invitation successful.  Want to get over the small number phobia of your media?  Libby and Ash breakdown their strategies to success, and reveal how to driving traffic from an authentic and organic place, without burning out.  Don’t forget to stick around for Ash’s post-episode notes!  

 

In this Episode, Learn How To:

  1. Start a Facebook group that will turn into a business.
  2. Overcome entrepreneurial
  3. Create a call to action that is authentic and successful.

 

Where to Find Libby Crow:

www.libbycrow.com

Instagram: @libbycrow

Podcast: Behind The Dream

Listen in this week as Ash interviews Chelsea Krost, an author, speaker and wildly successful strategist for marketing in the modern world.  She is someone who has been a major influencer in driving the evolution of internet marketing with millennials.  Chelsea deeply discusses the 5 stages to impact and build a brand.  If you think Marketing brand vision is just for the entrepreneur, think again!  Chelsea and Ash discuss how to position a personal brand for job seekers and growing your position as a leader in a niche corporate career.  If you are looking to generate an authentic audience or grow your influence, Chelsea suggests 1 ninja thing to do for 60 minutes every day.  Don’t forget to stay around for Ash’s post-episode notes!

item.title: [SMARTS] Ep. 51: Human Trafficking: What It Is + How To Stop It w/ Anna Ptak
item.description:
Did you know the US is the #1 destination for human trafficking?

In the new section Smarts, Ash interviews Anna Ptak, a speaker, advocate, ethical fashion designer and policy consultant who is helping the world overcome human trafficking.  Anna shares her personal experience in trafficking and the ways in which she has healed.  Anna and Ash discuss where trafficking typically exists, who is targeted, and the major link between sex trafficking and pornography.  Ana unlocks indicators for how to spot trafficking and what to do when you see it.  She reveals the world of human trafficking, the business model behind it and the laws around it.  This is a powerful and emotional topic!  Prior to the interview, Ash prepares everyone for the episode with background information on trafficking and shares her personal thoughts on trauma.

Resources:

Polaris Project https://polarisproject.org/

Safe Horizon https://www.safehorizon.org/

Anchor House https://www.restoreonelife.org/the-anchor-house-1

Instagrahm: @annaptak

 

Are you ready to unlock the best career for you?  Visit youturnpodcast.com/clarity

item.title: Ep. 50: Thoughts on Finding the Right Thing (From Ashley Stahl)
[MINDSET] Ep 49: How To Access Your Intuition w/ Noah Berman
item.description:
Have you ever felt you shouldn’t do something, but you did it anyway?

Join Ash this week as she meets with Noah Berman, a master of intuition and a median.  Noah reveals when and how you can better connect with your intuition and unlocks how to use your body as a channel in less than 1 minute.  He tells his intriguing story about discovering his intuition and ability to see and receive on a deeper level.  Noah provides actionable methods to connect with your intuition and find stillness.  Have you ever wondered what the signs and synchronicities appearing in your life mean for you?  Ash and Noah discuss how to understand these signs, how to create from a place of love to make life better and what rewinding the tape of your life really means.  As always, don’t miss Ash’s post-episode notes!

Resources:

Insight timer app: insighttimer.com

Find Noah on Instragrahm: @noahberman

noahbermanwellness.com
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever felt you shouldn’t do something, but you did it anyway?

Join Ash this week as she meets with Noah Berman, a master of intuition and a median.  Noah reveals when and how you can better connect with your intuition and unlocks how to use your body as a channel in less than 1 minute.  He tells his intriguing story about discovering his intuition and ability to see and receive on a deeper level.  Noah provides actionable methods to connect with your intuition and find stillness.  Have you ever wondered what the signs and synchronicities appearing in your life mean for you?  Ash and Noah discuss how to understand these signs, how to create from a place of love to make life better and what rewinding the tape of your life really means.  As always, don’t miss Ash’s post-episode notes!

Resources:

Insight timer app: insighttimer.com

Find Noah on Instragrahm: @noahberman

noahbermanwellness.com

item.title: Ep. 48: Thoughts on Making Tough Decisions (From Ashley Stahl)
[WORK] Ep. 47: How To Upgrade Your Mindset In Sales w/ Rachel Luna
item.description:
Are your leads not taking action?

Learn how to make that change this week Ash meets with Rachel Luna, a former US Marine, best selling author, host of the Real Talk Podcast, and sales mindset strategist. She discusses 2 things that stop people from being great at sales and reveals how to break free from them.  Whether you are an entrepreneur or a sales associate within a company, your mindset matters.  Rachel outlines 3 tactical approaches to improve your sales and shift your mindset going into promoting what you have to offer.  Want to talk about getting a raise or promotion?  These skills will work for you!  Stick around to hear Ash’s post-episode notes on sales in the workforce and as an entrepreneur!

Resources:

The Four Agreements by Don Miguel Ruiz

ca.confidenceactivated.com to attend Confidence Activated Event May 31st, 2019

Connect with Rachel on Instagram: @girlconfident

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 46: How To Experience True Love w/ Alexi Panos
item.description:
What are you really willing to do to experience true love in your relationship?

This week Ash interviews Alexi Panos, a life coach, successful author and the founder of Soul School, a monthly membership community centered in helping people tap into their highest potential.

Alexi dives right in to outline 5 steps to experience love in its truest form. Ash and Alexi discuss how to maintain a healthy relationship, how to let go of the idea of your perfect person, and how to work through disagreements effectively. The science behind couples that stay together the longest, reveals some powerful insight into compatibility, you won’t want to miss this! And as
always, stick around to hear Ash’s post-episode thoughts. This week she poses thought-provoking questions to determine if you are actually moving forward in your relationship and life.

Connect with Alexi Panos:
www.alexipanos.com
Instagram: @alexipanos

item.title: Ep. 45: [MINDSET] How to Create Powerful Friendships (And Release Toxic Ones) w/ Dhru Purohit
item.description:
Should you reevaluate your friendships?

Join Ashley this week as she interviews Dhru Purohit, an entrepreneur, filmmaker, and contributing author to NYT Clean Gut and Clean Eats.  He is the CEO of Ultrawellness Center, host of The Broken Brain Podcast and co-founder of the Clean Program.

Want to know the #1 most important thing in a lasting friendship? Listen in to find out.  Dhru lays out the indicators of a toxic friendship, how to release them and why they are harmful to your long term health.  Ash and Dhru discuss building positive relationships, how to compassionately let go of friendships that no longer serve you and the strength behind creating healthy boundaries.  Listen in to receive actionable ideas on breaking free from today’s isolation epidemic and level up your relationships.  During the post-episode notes, Ashley shares a list of things to look for in extraordinary friendships, you don’t want to miss it!

 

Resources:

A New Earth by Eckhart Toll

The Blue Zones By Buettner

Broken Brain Podcast

I’ve Got Your Back IGVT @dhrupurohit

 

Ready to create the life you love? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/clarity

Do you know what your core values are?  Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/corevalues

item.title: Ep. 44: Thoughts on Fulfillment (from Ashley Stahl)
[SMARTS] Ep. 43: What is Global Warming w/ Jane Mosbacher Morris
item.description:
Did you know you have an untapped superpower that can change the planet?

On this week’s episode, Ash talks with Jane Mosbacher Morris about the power within each of us when it comes to making an environmental impact.  Jane is the CEO of To the Market and Author of Buy The Change You Want To See.  She outlines what is happening with our environment and provides you simple, yet powerful, opportunities to positively make a change.  Do you know what buycotting is?  By the end of this episode, you will!  Jane reveals a surprising truth about what the people impacted by terrorism abroad really want and how this drove her career path.  Whether you are a consumer, small business or CEO of a Fortune 500 company there is something valuable to be heard from Jane.  As always, stick around to hear what Ash reveals in her notes!

Resources:

Buy The Change You Want To See By Jane Mosbacher Morris

Knowthechain.org

 

Ready to land the job you love? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/joboffer

item.title: Ep. 42: Thoughts on Intimacy (And Rock Bottom) from Ashley Stahl
[MINDSET] Ep. 41: The 3 Abundance Mindsets + Self Care Practices w/ Sahara Rose
item.description:
Do people really follow their dreams?

This week Ash sits down with someone who did!  Sahara Rose is the Best Selling Author of Idiots Guide to Ayurveda and Eat Feel Fresh, and her podcast Highest Self is an inspiring place to upgrade your mindset.  Sahara shares her healing health journey through Ayurveda, her path to publishing best-selling books and what it means to put the human back into your own life.   Listen in to learn some unique and powerful self-care rituals and mindset techniques that will uplevel your life, health, and practices with money.  Sahara blends Ayurvedic content into this modern world in a way we can all relate.  Ashley’s post-episode notes are not what you would expect after a wellness conversation, stick around to hear what she has to say!

Idiots Guide to Ayurveda  By Sahara Rose

Eat Feel Fresh By Sahara Rose

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 40: Key Ingredients to A Compatible Relationship w/ Nora DeKeyser
item.description:
Do you keep attracting the same relationship into your life?

Open your eyes to why that may be this week as Ash talks with Nora DeKeyser, an incredible matchmaker who connects people to their best partner, who often it isn’t the person you would think.  Nora and Ash dive into the power behind the 3 attachment styles, and the key steps to gain clarity around the person and relationship you want.  Nora immediately breaks down the signs of an incompatible relationship and shares insight into why we are ingrained to attract certain people.  And you will be surprised to hear the top 3 things men and women authentically seek in a partner.  Whether you are in a healthy relationship or living a single life, tune in to learn how to uplevel your relationship and keep that slow burning flame kindling now and in the future!  Ashley’s post-episode thoughts are definitely worth staying tuned in for!

 

Resources:

Attached By Rachel Heller

noradekeyser.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/clarity

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 39: How to Uplevel Your Money Mindset w/ Chris Harder
item.description:
How Are Your Current Money Patterns Limiting Your Success?

This week Ash sits down with Chris Harder, an entrepreneur and the founder of the For the Love of Money brand and podcast.  Join them to bust through your limiting beliefs with money so you can change your financial future.  Chris and Ashley discuss 2 key factors to write your ticket anywhere, indicators of your current money mindset, patterns with money and how you can use money and goals to improve and inspire relationships.  Walk down the path to take responsibility for your financial and life goals!  Like so many people, Chris hit rock bottom during the recession but he did something many didn’t.  Discover how he used this financial hardship to rebuild his views and mindset on money, relationships, and life.   Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-interview thoughts!

 

Resources:

You Are A Badass At Making Money By Jen Sincero

Secrets Of The Millionaire Mindset By T. Harv Eker

 

Find Chris Harder at:

For The Love Of Money Podcast

IG: chriswharder

www.fortheloveofmoney.com

 

Promotion:

Ready to discover the best career path for you? Visit YouTurnPodcast.com/clarity

item.title: Ep. 38: Thoughts on Speaking Up (From Ashley Stahl)
[WORK] Ep. 37: How to Better Love Yourself and Live More in Alignment w/ Philip McKernan
item.description:
This week, Ash interviews inspirational speaker, writer, and filmmaker, Philip McKernan, to find out how you can move through the roadblocks that many entrepreneurs face and find clarity on your career path. Through a series of stories, Philip will help you explore the possibilities of who you are and what you could be, exemplify the importance of courage and being honest with yourself, and explain why we should trust our intuition. Philip wants us to find a relationship with ourselves again and remember that we only give ourselves what we feel we deserve.

Philip’s Website: www.philipmckernan.com

Philip’s Book: One Last Talk

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 34: How to Create Attraction w/ Mat Boggs
item.description:
This week, Ash interviews best-selling author, speaker, and expert dating coach, Mat Boggs, about how to create, find, and keep attraction. Mat dives into the attractive mindset and explains that certain traits that might be getting you ahead in business and your career might be sabotaging your relationships. Through a series of touching stories, Mat shows us that in order to treat others with love, you must first love yourself, allow yourself to feel vulnerable, be your own best friend, and practice self-assertiveness.

Mat's Website: www.crackingthemancode.com

Free e-book for Listeners: 5 Feminine Qualities that High-Value Men Find Irresistible 

Mat's Book: Cracking the Man Code

Book Mentioned: Project Everlasting

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 33: How You Can Change Your Habits w/ Ajit Nawalkha
item.description:
This week, Ash interviews author and co-founder of Mindvalley and Evercoach, Ajit Nawalkha, about the magnification of social comparisons and how it affects the way we feel about our own lives. Ajit will discuss ways which we can rewire our brain, how we can get more connected to what our values are, and how life is less like a journey and more like a dance. Ash and Ajit will reimagine the notions surrounding goal setting and values, explain how we can get into a state of flow, give insight into how we can train our subconscious mind, and encourage us to be creators.

Ajit’s website: www.livebigthebook.com

Ajit’s Book: Live Big

Book Mentioned: The Book - Alan Watts

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 32: How to Figure Out What You Really Want w/ Amanda Steinberg
item.description:
Ashley talks with financial expert and founder of The Daily Worth, Amanda Steinberg about how to determine who you really are compared to the “you” societal norms determine you should be. Throughout the episode, Amanda gives some tips on how to break out of our culture’s collective narrative, how to design life on your terms, and how to let go of perceived "truths". Ashley and Amanda will dive deep and tell you how to find the courage to start breaking through the life formula you’re following, how to question your happiness with your current plan, and how to set your goals. Through her various tips and stories, you’ll learn how to create the life that you want, even if it’s abnormal!

Amanda's Book: Worth It

Book Mentioned: Loving What Is by Byron Katie

Find Amanda on social media: @amandasteinberg

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 31: How to Bounce Back from Rock Bottom w/ Danette May
item.description:
This week, Ash interviews best-selling author and creator of Fit Rise, Danette May, about how to rise up from your rock bottom and view your trying times as gifts and opportunities. Danette and Ashley discuss various tactics to help you turn your mess into your message, including finding someone or something uplifting to listen to, introducing affirmations to your daily routine, and flipping the script on the story you’re telling yourself right now. Danette will share her personal story, the concept of soul writing, and how you can own where you are and help change your mentality and, ultimately, your reality.

Danette’s recipes: www.getcacao.com

Danette’s website: www.danettemay.com

Danette’s Book: The Rise: An Unforgettable Journey of Self-Love, Forgiveness, and Transformation

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 30: How to Have More Connected Relationships w/ Kelsey Grant
item.description:
This week is all about relationships. Ashley speaks with love and relationship educator, Kelsey Grant, about how you can develop a safer relationship with yourself, and how your relationship with yourself directly correlates to your relationships with others. Kelsey emphasizes the importance of breath and resetting your system, and throughout the episode, she will discuss some methods to help you expand your language around emotion, cover both your physical and emotional needs, and determine your wants versus your needs.

Book mentioned: The Language of Emotion - Klara McLaren

Follow Kelsey on Instagram: @radicalselflove

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 29: How to Be An Incredible Negotiator w/ Chris Voss
item.description:
Get ready for a master class on negotiation. Ashley and Christopher Voss, lead international kidnapping investigator for the FBI, author of Never Split the Difference, and CEO of the Black Swan Group, discuss what it takes to be an incredible negotiator in your everyday life. Aside from the drive to get out in front of problems, negotiating also takes a great deal of initiative and imagination. Chris discusses various tactics that can help you when negotiating situations in your life such as pay raises, promotions, and even prenuptial agreements. These skills include giving the other party the illusion of power, letting the other side speak first, developing openness, and the importance of truly understanding what it means to be empathetic.

Subscribe to Christopher's company newsletter, The Edge: Text FBIempathy to 22828

Chris's Book: Never Split the Difference

Book Mentioned: The Culture Code - Daniel Coyle

Book Mentioned: Beyond Winning - Robert H. Mnookin

Book Mentioned: Way of the Wolf – Jordan Belfort

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 28: How to Have More Fun While You’re Achieving w/ Jason Goldberg
item.description:
On this week’s episode, Ashley and award-winning entrepreneur, author, TEDx speaker, and former rapper, Jason Goldberg tackle the complex balance of having fun while achieving your dreams. In this fun and deep-diving interview, Ashley and Jason discuss how to be high-performing and highly productive without accruing stress and anxiety, how to take the seriousness out of being successful, and how to change your perspective from good vs bad to less effective vs more effective. You will learn how to use the thoughts that are serving you and challenge the thoughts that hinder your progress by taking radical personal responsibility, and ultimately be able to answer the question: how do I intend to use my life today?

Check out Jason’s Websites:

Thejasongoldberg.com

Playfulprosperity.com

Jason's Book: Prison Break: Vanquish the Victim, Own Your Obstacles, and Lead Your Life

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 27: How to Tap Into Your Inner Leader w/ Drew Dudley
item.description:
This week, Ashley explores the concept of leadership with Drew Dudley, voted one of the 50 Most Inspirational TED Talkers of our time. Drew destroys the flawed definition of leadership that we have been taught, insisting that we step away from evaluating our accomplishments over blocks of time, and instead narrow down leadership through the lens of our daily existence. Once we can reframe what moments of leadership are, then we can recognize that there is no such thing as a “little” impact, and we can truly understand the importance of self-respect, keeping obligations to ourselves, and recognizing our insights, experience, and knowledge as it relates to our happiness. At the end of the interview, Drew shares a clear set of questions you can ask yourself each day so that when the future arrives, you will be the type of person you want to be.

LINKS: 

Drew’s website: www.drewdudley.com  

Drew’s Book: This is Day One – A Practical Guide To Leadership That Matters 

Follow Drew on Instagram & Twitter: @dayonedrew 

Book Mentioned: “Turning Pro” by Steven Pressfield

item.description:
This week’s episode dives deep into discovering what makes us who we are. Ashley and American film director, film maker, and poet Stephen Gyllenhaal explore the energy that defines us, from our connections we make every day with others, to our time in the womb, and even experiences marked on our genetics from previous generations. Find out how you can start to clearly understand who you are and what you want out of life.

Check out Stephen’s workshops and The Institute for Identity Development here.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 25: The Future Of The Workforce: How To Succeed w/Martin Yate
item.description:
Did you know by 2027, 16% of all jobs, in all professions, at all levels, could be replaced by robotics and artificial intelligence? On this week’s episode of the You Turn podcast, prolific author Martin Yate is here to discuss how to get out ahead of the robot takeover and gain job security and happiness in a world overrun by technology. Martin and Ashley discuss the numerous ways in which you can find success under any circumstances. From recognizing that success is a marathon and not a sprint, to the importance of embracing failure, Martin drops some serious, and hilarious, wisdom. As always, don’t forget to tune in to Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

You can find Martin at his website, knockemdead.com

item.description:
Have you ever asked yourself: Am I ready for a relationship? How will I know? Everyone’s been there, but the answers aren’t always so clear. On this episode of the You Turn podcast, relationship and intimacy expert Marla Mattenson is here to talk about just how to know when you’re ready to take that leap. She and Ashley discuss the seven signs that you’re ready for a relationship, how to pick the right partner, and how to trust your intuition to guide you. From discussing how to live an unapologetic life to always being your most authentic self, Marla drops some serious wisdom. Don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

item.description:
Everyone wants to know how to achieve the results we want in all aspects of life, be it work, relationships, or personal growth, but not everyone knows how to get there. Thankfully, this week’s episode of the You Turn podcast features the inspiring Stephanie Kwong, life coach and hypnotherapist. Stephanie joins Ashley to talk about how to reprogram your mind, learn to love yourself, and achieve whatever results you desire. Stephanie goes deep into the ways in which your subconscious generates your beliefs, and the five steps you can take to rewire your brain and truly become your own hypnotist.

item.description:
“Your greatest happiness lies on the other side of your greatest fear.”

Everyone wants to know how to build effective relationships, especially those that will enhance and improve their careers. On this week’s episode of the You Turn podcast, personal branding expert Selena Soo goes deep into how to build relationships with people that can actually help you in business. She and Ashley discuss the common blocks to cultivating these helpful relationships, and the five ways to meet and connect with the right people for your career. As always, stick around for Ashley’s post episode thoughts.

Give and Take: Why Helping Others Drives Our Success, Adam Grant

Never Eat Alone: And Other Secrets to Success, One Relationship at a Time, Keith Ferrazzi

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 21: How To Overcome Emotional Eating w/Sam Skelly
item.description:
Do you ever find yourself eating something you know will make you feel sick, or eating simply because you’re bored or upset? Emotional eating is real, it affects everyone, and it can be hard to get to the bottom of the issue. Luckily, this week Sam Skelly, CEO of Hungry for Happiness, is here to help. Sam is determined to help people to stop using food as a drug, and to start reconnecting to their bodies and souls. Overcoming emotional eating won’t happen overnight, but Sam and Ashley dive into the four steps necessary for acknowledging this behavior and getting clarity on how to stop it. From gaining self-trust to healing your body, you will learn how to really tune into yourself on this episode of the You Turn podcast. And don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

 Follow Sam on Instagram @samanthaskelly

 For more information and insights, check out Sam’s website here.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 20: How To Create A Personal Brand w/Angie Lee
item.description:
Do you ever wonder how you can achieve every single one of your goals? How you can generate your ultimate success, and reach the greatest heights possible? Look to further than this episode of the You Turn podcast, featuring life coach and entrepreneur Angie Lee. From the power of social media to being as optimistic as possible, Angie completely opens up about her path toward entrepreneurship (something she’d been drawn to since she was five) and how she generates her success. The key? You are in more control than you think, and you manifest what you believe. Angie and Ashley discuss how to become what you want to attract, how to create happiness and fulfillment through thought, and how to find “comfort in the question mark.” And as always, stick around for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

 Find Angie on her Facebook page here.

 Check out Angie on Instagram @angieleeshow

 Find more resources and information at angielee.com

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 19: How To Find Love (Or Keep It) w/Jane Garapick
item.description:
Have you ever had the thought, why does love feel so hard? Whether you’re single and can't seem to find the right person, or in a relationship and struggling with why things don’t feel as easy as they should, you’re not alone. Relationship and dating coach Jane Garapick joins Ashley on this episode of the You Turn Podcast to discuss why finding and keeping love can feel so hard, and how to break through those boundaries. Jane dives into the three steps to really learning the deep truths about yourself and what you look for in a partner, so you can truly find the person perfectly suited to you and your happiness. And don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

 Check out Jane’s website, gettingtotruelove.com

 You can also find more information on her program, Beautiful Confident Radiant You, here.

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 18: Find Your Spark At Work w/Jonathan Fields
item.description: Do you ever grapple with the sense of being purposeless when it comes to your career? It’s the biggest challenge people face at work, and it comes from not knowing how to truly find your spark. On this episode of the You Turn podcast, author and founder of The Good Life Jonathan Fields teaches you how to find that spark, and how to discover your purpose and what drives you. There is a pretty small set of fundamental drivers that are universal to most people, and they can be found by looking deeper, asking bigger questions, and getting more connected to yourself through awareness. Jonathan and Ashley dive deep into this awareness, and how to regain it. As always, don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

item.description:
The moment you realize that you have the all-knowing, infinite wisdom of the entire universe within yourself is the moment you truly begin awakening into yourself. On this episode of the You Turn podcast, Dr. Erin Haskell, doctor of divinity, bestselling author, and transformational speaker, joined Ashley to talk about the four steps to awaken into your highest self, and how to grow and gain confidence in your life. From seizing your integrity to healing through truth, Erin guides you through learning your power and really tuning in to your true, positive, enlightened self.

Awakening: A 40-Day Guide to Unleashing Your Spiritual Powers, Life's Purpose and Manifesting Your Dreams!, Erin Haskell

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 16: How To Get Into The Entrepreneurial Mindset w/Anik Singal
item.description:
Have you ever wondered what the difference is between an entrepreneur and an employee mindset? How do entrepreneurs find success, and what on earth is going on in their brains? Serial entrepreneur and author Anik Singal joins Ashley on this week’s episode of the You Turn podcast to help decode the mind of an entrepreneur, and help you find success! Anik went from near bankruptcy (and almost dying) to being one of the most successful entrepreneurs. He dives deep into the necessity of feeling your emotions (hint: he learned this from the TV show Lost), living in your true purpose, and the power of mentorship. Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

Escape: The 4 Stages of Becoming A Successful Entrepreneur, Anik Singal

Get a free copy of Anik’s book here: escapebook.com

Find Anik on Facebook and Instagram @singalanik

For more on Anik’s business, visit lurn.com

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 15: Step Into Your True Self w/Alyssa Nobriga
item.description:
We’ve all been there, stuck in our emotions, wallowing on the couch with a tub of ice cream. Maybe your self-critic is rearing its head, or your anxiety and self-doubt have taken up residence. Whatever the negative emotions may be, it’s all too easy to get lost and sucked in to them. 

That’s what leadership coach Alyssa Nobriga is here for! On this episode of the You Turn podcast, Alyssa discusses how to get clarity on who you are, what you want, and how to be in the world as a centered and intentional being. She and Ashley discuss the importance of defining success for yourself, being conscious of moving toward your goals, and transforming your negative emotions and doubts into values and intentions. From nightly journaling to realigning your life to center around your core values, Alyssa is here to let you in on all the secrets, so you can finally step in to who you truly are. Don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

You can find Alyssa on her website: www.alyssanobriga.com 

Check out Alyssa's Twitter: @AwakeInSpirit

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 14: How To Be A Powerful Communicator (The 4 Types of Energy) w/Jennifer Russell
item.description:
Do you ever notice that certain people communicate in a way that gets them better results—raises at work, relationships, or new friends? You can learn how to do that! Jennifer Russell, executive coach, is here to talk about the importance of your ability to hold charisma and inspire people, and how claim your power. We all lead with different energy when we communicate, but she has discovered four faces of powerful communication that everyone has the ability to possess. On this week’s episode of the You Turn podcast, Jennifer talks to Ashley about these four approaches of power, and how you can step in to them no matter what your values or strengths are. Walk away from the episode knowing exactly which one you are, and how to tap into every single one in order to embrace more inspired communication and boost your ability to fascinate anyone. As always, don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

 

Check out Jennifer’s website: www.jennifersrussell.com

For access to a FREE power profile, visit www.jennifersrussell.com/powerprofile

For more resources: https://evolvinglove.us/

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 13: How Your Diet Can Help You Focus At Work w/Max Lugavere
item.description:
Did you know your eating and exercise habits can actually affect your work? That’s what Max Lugareve and Ashley talk about on this week’s episode. Health and science expert and New York Times best selling author Max Lugavere is here to help you decipher how you can change your life by changing your foods and habits! On this episode of the You Turn podcast, he and Ashley discuss everything from the dangers of commercial salad dressing to the importance of movement, sleep, and getting off your devices. If you want to learn how to do better in your job, reshape your focus, or even find out the best foods to eat before a job interview, tune in to hear Max talk about it all. As always, stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

Genius Foods: Become Smarter, Happier, and More Productive While Protecting Your Brain for Life, Max Lugavere

Take a peek at Max’s documentary, Bread Head, here: http://breadheadmovie.com/

 Check out The Genius Life podcast here: https://www.maxlugavere.com/podcast-1/

 You can reach Max at his website https://www.maxlugavere.com/ or on Instagram/Twitter @maxlugavere

Health and science expert and New York Times best selling author Max Lugavere is here to help you decipher how you can change your life by changing your foods and habits! On this episode of the You Turn podcast, he and Ashley discuss everything from the dangers of commercial salad dressing to the importance of movement, sleep, and getting off your devices. If you want to learn how to do better in your job, reshape your focus, or even find out the best foods to eat before a job interview, tune in to hear Max talk about it all. As always, stay tuned for Ashley’s post episode thoughts!

Genius Foods: Become Smarter, Happier, and More Productive While Protecting Your Brain for Life, Max Lugavere

Take a peek at Max’s documentary, Bread Head, here: http://breadheadmovie.com/

 Check out The Genius Life podcast here: https://www.maxlugavere.com/podcast-1/

 You can reach Max at his website https://www.maxlugavere.com/ or on Instagram/Twitter @maxlugavere

item.title: [LOVE] Ep. 12: Get In Touch With Your Heart w/Evan Marc Katz
item.description:
“Once you wake up, you can’t go back to sleep.”

 We all want to be in happy, healthy, satisfying relationships… so how do we get there? On this week’s episode of the You Turn Podcast, dating and relationship expert/author Evan Marc Katz divulges the secrets to finding your best relationship and being blissfully happy. He and Ashley dive in to the differences between men and women, the universality of online dating, the importance of communication, and more! Be more intentional when it comes to your relationships, learn how to take action (whether you’re single or taken), and really tap in to your heart. Don’t forget to stay tuned for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts!

I Can’t Believe I’m Buying This Book, Evan Marc Katz

Why You’re Still Single, Evan Marc Katz

A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life’s Purpose, Eckhart Tolle 

Find all of Evan Marc Katz’s resources, including his blog, on his website, evanmarckatz.com

item.title: [WORK] Ep. 11: “How to achieve greatness” w/ Jay Abraham
item.description:
This week's episode of the You Turn podcast features Jay Abraham — author, mentor, and the godfather of marketing. Jay is one of the world's most influential executives and coaches, and talks to Ashley about a multitude of incredibly helpful things, including developing the "you attitude." Tune in to learn how to better market yourself, stand up for what you're worth, and discover what greatness looks like in your life. Jay has limitless personal anecdotes about how to discover your value and worth as an employee and person, and how to reach the level of success you desire. Don't forget to stay tuned for Ashley's post-episode thoughts!

 

 

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, Stephen R. Covey

 

Check out Jay Abraham’s website: www.abraham.com

item.title: [MINDSET] Ep. 10: “Tapping in to your truth” w/Kute Blackson
item.description:
Do you ever find yourself avoiding the truth? We’re conditioned to tell ourselves lies, according to this week’s guest. In this episode of the “You Turn” podcast, author and visionary Kute Blackson talks about how we can overcome our conditioning in order to tap in to our truth. Tune in to learn how to stop playing the “game of confusion.” Ashley and Kute discuss all of the ways to start feeling and accepting the truth, from becoming aware of your own patterns and accepting responsibility to slowing down and creating some space in life. Kute also discusses following your impulses, chasing your dreams, and “feeling your death.” Life will reveal itself to you… What do you have to lose? As always, don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts!

 

You Are The One, Kute Blackson

 

Find his blog posts and more on his websites: http://kuteblackson.com and http://www.boundlessblissbali.com/

 

You can find Kute on Twitter at @kuteblackson

 

Explore Kute’s vlogs and inspirational videos on his Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtD6zAv6aPq7OQtB5kLAghg

item.title: [LOVE]: EP: 9 “How To Upgrade Your Worthiness In Love” w/ Laurie Davis Edwards
item.description:
This week’s episode of the “You Turn” podcast involves that omnipresent fear we all have — are we worthy of love? In this episode, Laurie Davis Edwards talks about how to upgrade your worthiness in love, and how to tackle fear in relationships. What is it about the way we talk to ourselves that makes us compromise on what’s most important to us when it comes to love? Davis breaks down the four core relationship fears (worthiness, abandonment, commitment, and trust) in order to dive into how to change our fears and ideas of worthiness when it comes to love. Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts! 

You can find Laurie Davis Edwards on Twitter here: https://twitter.com/Ldavisedwards

Find her blog posts and more on her website: https://www.theworthyone.com/

item.title: [WORK] 8: "The Secret To Truly Successful People" w/ Alex Banayan (Bestselling Author)
item.description: Believe it or not, your career is a lot like a nightclub. There's the front door, where the lines are long and everyone is waiting to get in... There's the back door, where the VIPS go and the line's less intense, and then... There's the THIRD DOOR: the one where the resourceful and creative people go, with minimal lines. Bestselling Author Alex Banayan, author of The Third Door, shares his journey on an unprecedented adventure—from hacking Warren Buffett’s shareholders meeting to chasing Larry King through a grocery store to celebrating in a nightclub with Lady Gaga—as Alex Banayan travels from icon to icon, decoding their success.

item.title: [MINDSET] 7: "How To Tap Into Your Zone Of Genius" w/ Vanessa Horn
item.description: On this week’s episode of the “You Turn” podcast, Vanessa Horn talks to Ashley about how to simultaneously make the most money and find the most fulfillment in life, which she coins the "zone of genius." Tune in to get advice on discovering your own path to purposeful living, and why it’s important to honor your heart along the way. What makes you come alive? What makes you feel good? What are your natural skillsets? Answering these questions will lead you to that zone of genius. And of course, stick around for some post-episode thoughts from Ashley!

item.title: [LOVE] 6: "Make Your Mess Your Message" w/ Mark Groves
item.description: This week's episode of "You Turn Podcast w/ Ashley Stahl" will encourage you to focus on feelings that we often avoid, so prepare to go deep! Mark Groves’s own journey in life and love proves that heart break offers the opportunity to let go of that which prevented us from being who we truly are. Mark and Ashley discuss the importance of looking within ourselves to instigate transformation and reach our full potential. Don't forget to tune in for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts! Find Mark Groves at www.MarkGroves.tv and on Instagram: @MarkGrovesTV.

item.title: [WORK] 5: "How To Feel More Alive In Your Job" w/ Dan Cable
item.description: Often times we associate the word “work” with what we don’t want to do, but Dan Cable explores the other approach: getting a buzz from it. It’s less about the job, and more about the way you use that job. Tune in to this deeply insightful conversation on how to connect and explore the work you’re already doing. Which tasks at work light you up? And how can you add more of them to your daily professional routine to add purpose and effect? Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts on Dan Cable, job-crafting and finding your light at work!

item.description: This week’s episode of the “You Turn Podcast w/ Ashley Stahl” will motivate you to look inward and “come back home” to your most authentic self. Kylie and Ashley discuss how to navigate the different stages of romantic relationships while still honoring one’s true self. Kylie prompts Ash to go deep with some thought-provoking questions about core values and relationships—tune in and answer the questions for yourself, too. As always, stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts!

item.title: [LOVE] 3: "Why You Haven't Found Lasting Love" w/ Annie Lalla
item.description: If you’re searching for a partner or a lasting relationship, Annie Lalla will inspire you to dig into your unconscious and explore what you’re afraid of giving up. Annie is determined to help skeptics believe in love, and in this episode, she provides a list of items for you to contemplate if you feel like a skeptic or “forever alone” yourself. Ashley and Annie discuss the ways to build oneself into a Mrs. or Mr. Right—and it doesn’t happen overnight. Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts on Annie and finding love!

item.title: [WORK] 2: "Why You Get Derailed At Work (And How To Stop It)" w/ Carter Cast
item.description: Tune in this week to hear former CEO of Walmart.com Carter Cast discuss the ways we alienate ourselves & never reach success through lack interpersonal skills. Find work that fully absorbs you and you’re going to do well at it, period. Carter discusses the act of tapping into your space for that passion work by getting comfortable with saying “no.” Don’t forget to stick around for Ashley’s post-episode thoughts!

item.title: [MINDSET] 1: "Willpower Doesn't Work—Here's A Better Way To Reach Your Goals" w/ Ben Hardy
item.description: On the inaugural episode of the "You Turn Podcast," Ashley interviews her good friend, writer and #1 most-read blogger on Medium.com, Benjamin Hardy. Ben and Ashley explore behavior-shaped personalities, the power in self-investing, and delve into discussion on secret-keeping and why it's so unhealthy to keep things to ourselves. The most fascinating part of the episode involves how to upgrade your results in life—tune in for Ben's genius on that. Also, don't forget to stick around for Ashley's post-episode thoughts! Ben Hardy's new book, "Willpower Doesn't Work: Discover the Hidden Keys to Success" is on shelves now!
